content: Paulin is a brand founded in 2013 by three sisters named Elizabeth, Charlotte and Eleanor Paulin. With headquarters in Glasgow, Scotland, Paulin is a company that is all about family, creativity, and… [+573 chars]

title: Cemex Shares Soar Amid Record Net Income Even as Sales Fall
content: Cemex SAB’s shares climbed after it posted record net income in the first quarter, with the Mexican company benefiting from higher prices and embarking on an extensive cost-cutting program.

title: Oil Slumps as Traders Await Next Moves in China, Economic Data
content: Oil sunk as traders parsed economic data from the US and the latest signals out of the trade war, including China’s efforts to support its tariff-hit economy.

title: Google Parent Alphabet Leads US High-Grade Issuance Rush
content: Companies are looking to sell the most high-grade bonds in one day since March, with 15 corporations including Alphabet Inc. preparing blue-chip note sales on Monday, another sign that debt markets are stabilizing after the turmoil brought by tariff announcements early this month.

title: Silver Lake, P2 Weigh Sale of Blackhawk Network for More Than $5 Billion
content: Silver Lake Management and P2 Capital Partners are exploring a potential sale of Blackhawk Network, seeking more than $5 billion for the prepaid gift card provider, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Nasdaq 100 Falls 1% in Countdown to Tech Earnings: Markets Wrap
content: A selloff in big tech dragged down stocks at the start of a busy week for corporate earnings and key economic data, with investors awaiting more clarity on the impacts of President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: 23andMe Bankruptcy Bid Deadline Extended as DNA Privacy Woes Linger
content: The sale of the bankrupt DNA data bank 23andMe is facing delays as the company tries to find a lead bidder that can quickly clear regulatory hurdles and guarantee customer privacy rules will be honored.

title: Temu and Shein to Pass All Of Trump Tariffs To US Shoppers
content: Discount Chinese retail Temu appears to be passing on almost all of Donald Trump’s new import taxes to US consumers, more than doubling the cost of some products in a move that may add to concern about the inflationary impact of tariffs. And Shein has raised US prices of its products from dresses to kitchenware by as much as 377% ahead of imminent tariffs on small parcels. The supply shock could lead to empty shelves, higher prices, and significant layoffs in industries such as trucking, logistics, and retail, with some economists warning of "Covid-like" shortages. Bloomberg's Poonam Goyal reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Canada Cannot Wait Out Trump: Ex-Liberal Party Leader
content: Mark Carney is "crisis hardened" says Michael Ignatieff, former leader of Canada's Liberal Party. Whoever wins Monday's general election, he adds, "there's going to be a lot of action on the economic front." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Insider Trader Gets Jail as SEC Reconsiders Tool That Caught Him
content: An Oregon retiree was ordered to spend a year behind bars for conspiring with a Nuveen LLC trader in a $47 million insider trading scheme — a case flagged by a controversial SEC tracking tool the Trump administration is considering reining in.

title: Big Tech Weighs on US Stocks Ahead of Earnings, Key Eco Data
content: US stocks declined, with shares of big technology firms leading losses ahead of crucial corporate earnings results later in the week.

title: Small Business Owners Push for Tariff Relief
content: Babylist CEO Natalie Gordon is calling on the Trump administration for tariff breaks on critical baby products like car seats, cribs, and strollers. She joined Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about the small business push for tariff relief.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: US Sanctions Three Ships Allegedly Linked to Iran-Backed Houthis
content: The US is imposing sanctions on three vessels for allegedly delivering refined petroleum products to the Houthis, a sign of continued US pressure as it negotiates with Iran about Tehran’s nuclear program.

title: Will Giant Rats Chase Investors Away From This UK City?
content: Bloomberg Opinion columnist Matthew Brooker explains how Birmingham’s garbage strike could be a bad sign for the Labor Party's dreams of foreign investment. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Merck KGaA to Buy Springworks for $3.9B
content: German pharma company Merck is buying US biotech SpringWorks Therapeutics for $3.9B.  SpringWorks makes medicines for cancer and rare diseases and is expected to give a boost to Merck's health-care division. Belen Garijo, Merck KGaA CEO joined Bloomberg Open Interest to talk about the deal.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bulgaria Sells €4 Billion in Its Biggest Euro Debt Haul
content: Bulgaria sold a total of €4 billion ($4.5 billion) in bonds, its biggest ever haul of euro-denominated debt in a single day, to fund its growing budget deficit in preparation for euro adoption.

title: Rithm CEO on M&A in Real Estate, Possible Newrez IPO
content: Michael Nierenberg, Rithm Capital chair, president and CEO, joins Wall Street Beat on "Bloomberg Open Interest" to talk about M&A in the real estate space and how to find opportunities in these volatile markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump EPA Approves Sales of High-Ethanol E15 Gasoline for Summer
content: The Trump administration announced it is allowing nationwide sales of higher-ethanol E15 gasoline this summer, a move it said would would keep gasoline prices low and support US agriculture.

title: German Drugmaker Stada Set to Refinance Debt After IPO Delay
content: German drugmaker Stada Arzneimittel AG is looking to refinance some of its junk debt, after pushing back a planned initial public offering intended to cut its liabilities.

title: European Stocks Resume Climb as M&A News Outweighs Trade Worries
content: European equities climbed as investors grew more optimistic that the worst-case impacts from US tariffs could be averted and as they parsed a flurry of merger and acquisition news.

title: How Will AI Drive Energy Demand? : BNEF
content:
AI is transforming the global economy, and is expected to place huge demands on energy.
Matthias Kimmel, the Head of Energy Economics at BloombergNEF, spoke to Tom Mackenzie on the outlook for power-hungry data centers as part of BloombergNEF's New Energy Outlook for this year. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Emerging-Market Stocks Extend Rally as Tariff Sentiment Improves
content: Stocks in developing nations climbed on Monday, with the benchmark index heading for its highest close in three weeks, amid optimism over trade talks between the US and its partners.

title: Trump’s Desire for Cheap Crude Puts Big Oil’s Plans to Test
content: Big Oil has a powerful ally in the White House, but the first quarter of Donald Trump’s presidency was a real test for companies’ plans. The rest of the year could be even tougher.

title: South Africa, Kenya are Private Equity Bright Spots Despite Trump’s Trade Chaos
content: A majority of private equity investors see South Africa and Kenya as their top investment destinations over the next three years even as US President Donald Trump’s tariff chaos muddies fund-raising outlook for the continent in 2025, according to the African Private Capital Association.

title: Trade War Looms Over Earnings From Apple, Microsoft and More
content:
Magnificent Seven stocks are mixed on Monday as traders brace for a deluge of corporate earnings later in the week. Nvidia shares fell early on as the Wall Street Journal reported that Huawei is getting ready to test a new and powerful artificial intelligence processor that the Chinese tech giant hopes can replace some Nvidia products. Alphabet, Microsoft and Amazon are edging lower, while Tesla, Meta and Apple are muted.

Meanwhile, Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said “all aspects” of the US government are in contact with China but that it’s up to Beijing to take the first step in de-escalating the tariff fight with President Donald Trump and the US due to the imbalance of trade between the two nations.

Lori Calvasina, Head of US Equity Strategy at RBC Capital Markets, explains why larger firms are better positioned to navigate the uncertainly than their smaller peers. Lori speaks with Tom Keene and Paul Sweeney on Bloomberg Radio. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Bloomberg Surveillance 04/28/2025
content: Jonathan Ferro, Lisa Abramowicz and Annmarie Hordern speak daily with leaders and decision makers from Wall Street to Washington and beyond. No other program better positions investors and executives for the trading day. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Hydrogen Maker Plug Power Shares Soar on $525 Million Debt Deal
content: Plug Power Inc. shares jumped the most in nearly a year after the hydrogen company announced a $525 million secured debt facility, said it doesn’t plan to raise more equity in 2025 and reported preliminary first-quarter results in line with analysts’ estimates.

title: Saks Seeks to Reassure Creditors That Its Shelves Are Stocked
content: Saks Global Enterprises told creditors its vendor troubles have eased and inventory is up after it instituted a plan in February to gradually pay suppliers past due balances over the course of more than a year.

title: Petro’s ‘Vampire’ IMF Spat Sends Colombian Assets Tumbling
content: Colombian assets dropped after the International Monetary Fund paused access to an $8.1 billion credit line, adding to concerns about the South American country’s widening budget deficit.

title: The Eerie Calm in the S&P 500
content: Everyone’s so gloomy. The stock market is holding up.

title: Stay Invested in US Stocks, BlackRock's Chaudhuri Advises
content: "Investors who have completely left the markets and moved to cash have missed out," Gargi Chaudhuri, BlackRock's chief investment and portfolio strategist, Americas, says on "Bloomberg Open Interest." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: New York City Transit System Chips Away at Subway Fare Evasion
content: Fare evasion on New York City’s subways and buses continues to decline as the nation’s largest transit agency seeks to get more riders to pay for service.

title: Trump Predicts Hegseth Will ‘Get It Together’ Despite Controversies
content: President Donald Trump said he thinks embattled Defense Secretary Pete Hegseth will “get it together,” suggesting he’ll stick with his choice to lead the Pentagon despite recent turmoil.

title: Global Military Spending Surges as Europe Tackles Russian Threat
content: Defense spending surged last year by the most since at least the end of the Cold War, according to data published Monday, with European countries rushing to bolster their security in the face of threats from Russia.

title: US Sanctions Three Ships Allegedly Linked to Iran-Backed Houthis
content: The US is imposing sanctions on three vessels for allegedly delivering refined petroleum products to the Houthis, a sign of continued US pressure as it negotiates with Iran about Tehran’s nuclear program.

title: Bessent, GOP Huddle on Taxes as Economic Tension Builds
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and congressional Republicans will meet to sketch out the plan for passing a multi-trillion tax cut in the coming weeks as polling shows that voters largely disapprove of the White House’s handling of the economy.

title: Trump Preps Orders Targeting Sanctuary Cities, Police Reform
content: President Donald Trump will sign executive orders the White House says will help law enforcement implement his sweeping deportation agenda by cracking down on places that restrict cooperation with immigration enforcement.

title: Hungary Rejects US Pressure to Cut Its Chinese Economic Ties
content: Hungary won’t reduce its economic ties with China, the nation’s minister of economy said, in the clearest sign yet that Prime Minister Viktor Orban’s government won’t bow to US pressure to distance itself from Beijing.

title: NYC’s Congestion Toll Raised $159 Million in the First Quarter
content: New York City’s congestion pricing toll pulled in $159 million in the first three months of the program as the Trump administration is pushing to end the controversial initiative.

title: US Urges Eastern Europe to Split From EU Energy Transition Aims
content: The US wants central and eastern European countries to join its path of “energy freedom” instead of following the wider region’s transition to a net zero economy, Energy Secretary Chris Wright said in Warsaw.

title: New Yorkers Boo and Jeer GOP’s Lawler at Circus-Like Town Hall
content: Boos, shouts and insults dominated New York Representative Mike Lawler’s rowdy town hall on Sunday as the GOP lawmaker’s constituents seethed over President Donald Trump and Republicans in Congress.

title: Putin’s Brief Ukraine Truce Frustrates Trump Plan to End War
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin declared a new temporary ceasefire in his war on Ukraine to mark the 80th anniversary of the victory in World War II, drawing criticism from the US as it seeks to negotiate a peace deal.

title: BRICS Seeks to Fill Void Left by G-20 as Trump’s Trade War Rages
content: Major emerging market nations are striving to turn the BRICS group into a global forum capable of addressing the economic and political chaos unleashed by Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Merz Taps Corporate Germany as Cabinet Starts to Take Shape
content: Germany’s Christian Democratic Union named two executives as cabinet ministers to serve under conservative Chancellor-in-waiting Friedrich Merz, filling key positions with business experts as the new government faces pressure to revive growth.

title: Carney’s Edge Slips as Canada Election Comes to Hectic End
content: The Conservative Party chipped away at the lead held by Mark Carney’s Liberals in the final days of Canada’s election campaign, though surveys still point to a probable Liberal victory in Monday’s vote.

title: IBM Plans to Invest $150 Billion in US Over Next Five Years
content: International Business Machines Corp. plans to invest $150 billion in the US over the next five years, joining a cohort of companies that have announced spending commitments following President Donald Trump’s election and tariff threats.

title: Bessent Says ‘It’s Up to China to De-Escalate’ in Trade War
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said “all aspects” of the US government are in contact with China but that it’s up to Beijing to take the first step in de-escalating the tariff fight with the US due to the imbalance of trade between the two nations.

title: India, UK Spar Over Key Issues as Trade Pact Nears Finish Line
content: Talks between the UK and India on a free trade agreement have entered the final stretch, with both sides now wrangling over five unresolved issues, according to an official in New Delhi familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Promised a Markets Boom. 100 Days In, Stocks Have Only Seen Damage
content: Donald Trump promised Americans a “boom like no other” if they elected him president. But based on the stock market’s performance during his first 100 days in office, it depends on what you mean by “boom.”

title: Israel Offers US Trade Concession in Effort to Avoid Tariff Pain
content: Israel plans to make a major regulatory concession to Washington in a bid to get a better deal from President Donald Trump over tariffs, Economy and Industry Minister Nir Barkat said.

title: Trump Cuts Threaten Americans’ Safety Net Just as More Are Expected to Need It
content: As tariffs spur worries of an economic downturn, Americans are poised to face higher costs with fewer resources to rely on.

title: Trump’s Polls Sag Near 100-Day Mark, Raising Tax-Plan Stakes
content: Voter discontent with President Donald Trump’s economic stewardship is sinking his popularity as he approaches the symbolic 100-day mark of his second term, ratcheting up pressure on congressional Republicans to pass his tax plan.

title: Trump China Tariffs Set to Unleash Supply Jolt on US Economy
content: President Donald Trump’s tariff onslaught has roiled Washington and Wall Street for nearly a month. If the trade war persists, the next upheaval will hit much closer to home.

title: Philippines Aims to Lower US Tariff to Zero During Talks
content: The Philippines will seek to bring down its US tariff rate to zero from the 17% earlier announced by President Donald Trump during talks with officials in Washington, the Southeast Asian nation’s trade chief said.

title: Trump Tells Americans What Putin Wants Them to Hear
content: Donald Trump’s Russia policy has been sounding very familiar to the Kremlin.

title: Asia Forges Ahead of Europe in Trade Deal Push
content: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.

title: China Asserts Sovereignty Over Disputed Reef in South China Sea
content: China has asserted sovereignty over an uninhabited reef in the South China Sea by planting a flag, according to state media, setting the stage for an escalation of tensions with the Philippines over the disputed area.

title: Hungary’s Orban Gets EU Complaint in Billion-Euro Media Bankroll
content: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban is facing a potential new conflict with the European Union over allegations that he bankrolled pro-government media in the country with over €1 billion ($1.1 billion) in state support.

title: North Korea Admits Sending Troops to Aid Russian War on Kyiv
content: North Korea acknowledged for the first time that it deployed troops to support Russia’s war on Ukraine, claiming the country’s military had helped Moscow retake control of the border region of Kursk.

title: Philippine Official Says China Trying to Influence Its Elections
content: A Philippine national security official said China is “attempting to influence” the Southeast Asian nation’s midterm elections next month after Beijing asserted sovereignty over an uninhabited reef in the South China Sea.

title: Tourism Hot Spot Thailand Launches Digital Arrival Card for Foreign Visitors
content: Thailand will require foreign visitors to fill up a pre-departure digital form from May 1, a move that will make it easy for authorities to track travelers amid a broadening crackdown against human trafficking into Southeast Asia’s illegal cybercrime centers.

title: Trump Tariffs Set to Shock Supply Chains Within Weeks
content:
Cargo shipments from China to the US have plummeted by as much as 60% since the US raised tariffs to 145% in early April, and thousands of companies will need to replenish inventories by mid-May.
The supply shock could lead to empty shelves, higher prices, and significant layoffs in industries such as trucking, logistics, and retail, with some economists warning of "Covid-like" shortages. Bloomberg's Brendan Murray reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Allegra Stratton: Can Rachel Reeves Juice Growth?
content: At the time of writing, Europe has been plunged into its most disruptive power cut in recent history – millions across Spain and Portugal are struggling without electricity. Early suggestions of a cyber attack have given way to the likelihood it was a simple technical fault. Follow Bloomberg’s live blog for excellent analysis including Will Matthis on the race against time – as night approaches – for these nations to delicately restart their power.

title: Spain, Portugal Suffer Widespread Power Blackout
content: Most of Spain and all of Portugal were hit by a major blackout that impacted public transport, airports and phone service. The outage, which hit millions of people, was due to sharp swings in power on the network, known as oscillations, according to grid operator Red Electrica.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Brussels Airport Cancels Tuesday Flight Departures on Strike
content: Brussels Airport is canceling all departing flights on Tuesday due to security and other ground staff participating in a nationwide strike, according to a statement on the airport operator’s website published Monday.

content: Get caught up.

content: Source: Bloomberg, 3:50

title: Private Equity Goes on the Offense with Defense Investments
content: Hi, it’s Aaron Kirchfeld and Swetha Gopinath in London, reporting on how private equity firms are discovering their appetite for investing in defense companies. Also today, the latest chapter in Italian M&A's ‘Game of Thrones’.

title: How a Trump-Fueled Trade War Will Impact the US Economy
content:
President Donald Trump’s tariff onslaught has roiled Washington and Wall Street for nearly a month. If the trade war persists, the next upheaval will hit much closer to home.

Since the US raised levies on China to 145% in early April, cargo shipments have plummeted, perhaps by as much as 60%, according to one estimate. That drastic reduction in goods from one of the largest US trading partners hasn’t been felt by many Americans yet, but that’s about to change.

Joseph "Joe" Lavorgna, SMBC Nikko Securities America Chief Economist and the former Chief Economist for the National Economic Council, offers an optimistic view on the Trump trade war and how it could ultimately benefit the United States. Joe speaks with Tom Keene and Paul Sweeney Bloomberg Radio. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Everyone’s so gloomy. The stock market is holding up.

title: What Trump's Low Approval Rating Means for the GOP
content:
Voter discontent with President Donald Trump’s economic stewardship is sinking his popularity as he approaches the symbolic 100-day mark of his second term, ratcheting up pressure on congressional Republicans to pass his tax plan. 

A flurry of polls in recent days from NBC,  CNN, New York Times/Siena, ABC News and Fox News, among others, each reveal the same theme: Voters perceive Trump to be falling short on his core campaign promise to strengthen the economy. The president’s helter-skelter rollout of tariffs in early April sent global markets into shock.

Veda Partners Director of Economic Policy Henrietta Treyz discusses what the unfavorable polling data could mean for the Republican party in the near-term. Henrietta speaks with Tom Keene and Paul Sweeney Bloomberg Radio. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Dubai, Abu Dhabi Millionaire Boom May Have Legs
content: Welcome to the Mideast Money newsletter, I’m Adveith Nair. Join us each week as my team and I chronicle the intersection of money and power in a region that's become one of the most influential in global finance. You can sign up here.

title: Weather Maps in 3D Could Help Explain Extreme Climate Patterns
content: Graphics remain overwhelmingly two-dimensional, even though the atmosphere operates across three dimensions, and that presents limitations.

content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:10

title: Spain, Portugal Hit by Power Blackouts
content: Most of Spain and parts of Portugal were hit by a major blackout that impacted power and phone lines at around noon on Monday. Bloomberg’s Jonathan Ferro breaks the news on Bloomberg Television.

title: Trump Tariffs on Steroids Will Rewire Solar Supply Chains
content: Imports from Southeast Asia were hit with sky-high levies, a move that’s set to reverberate through the renewable energy industry.

title: How China Could Emerge Stronger From Trump’s Auto Tariffs
content: The president is shaking would-be investors’ confidence in the US just as China’s car sector flourishes.

content: Source: Bloomberg, 10:03

title: US Weather Agency Risks Loss of Data Network, Internet Service
content: A key contract that supports the network service provider for the US National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration is set to lapse this week, threatening internet access and the transmission of internal data nationwide for much of the agency.

title: Musk ‘Super Fan’ Eyes Texas Shift for $110 Billion MercadoLibre
content: MercadoLibre Inc., Latin America’s most valuable company, is asking shareholders to approve a plan to move its domicile to Texas from Delaware amid a wave of firms reconsidering the long-standing corporate haven after a public spat between a judge and Elon Musk.

title: Google Parent Alphabet Leads US High-Grade Issuance Rush
content: Companies are looking to sell the most high-grade bonds in one day since March, with 15 corporations including Alphabet Inc. preparing blue-chip note sales on Monday, another sign that debt markets are stabilizing after the turmoil brought by tariff announcements early this month.

title: Sony Weighs Chip Spinoff That Dan Loeb Called for Years Ago
content: Sony Group Corp. is considering spinning off its semiconductor unit, according to people familiar with the matter, marking the PlayStation maker’s latest effort to streamline its business and focus on entertainment.

title: UAE Data Center Firm Plans Saudi Push After Silver Lake Deal
content: Khazna, a data center developer in the United Arab Emirates, is planning a major expansion in neighboring Saudi Arabia as the oil-rich nations compete to power the artificial intelligence boom.

title: Big Tech’s Earnings Problem Is Estimates May Be Way Too High
content: The last time Big Tech delivered earnings, Donald Trump had just started his second term, stocks were soaring on expectations of a pro-growth agenda and investors’ main worry was how long it would take companies to convert their artificial intelligence spending into profits.

title: Thiel-Backed Fintech N26 to Offer Mobile Service to Boost Growth
content: N26, the Peter Thiel-backed German neobank, is planning to offer mobile phone contracts to customers as it seeks new avenues for growth, copying a strategy that its larger competitor Revolut introduced last year.

title: IBM Plans to Invest $150 Billion in US Over Next Five Years
content: International Business Machines Corp. plans to invest $150 billion in the US over the next five years, joining a cohort of companies that have announced spending commitments following President Donald Trump’s election and tariff threats.

title: AI Startup Nscale Chases ByteDance Deal and $1.8 Billion in Debt
content: Nscale, a startup that is less than a year old, is already trying to raise about $2.7 billion to build artificial intelligence infrastructure on the back of a pending partnership with ByteDance Ltd., the Chinese owner of TikTok, according to an offering document seen by Bloomberg.

title: Deliveroo Shares Jump After $3.6 Billion DoorDash Offer
content: Deliveroo Plc shares surged by more than 18% on Monday, the most since 2021, after the British delivery firm disclosed an acquisition offer from DoorDash Inc.

title: Zepto Founders’ Special Situations India Deal to Yield 16%
content: The founders of Indian quick commerce company Zepto Marketplace Pvt. are planning to raise 15 billion rupees ($176 million) in a private credit deal that will offer investors as much as 16% yield, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Intel CEO Targets Change in Corporate Culture to Shape Up
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Ian King looks at the issues confronting Intel Corp.’s new Chief Executive Officer Lip-Bu Tan as he seeks to turn around the chipmaker’s fortunes.

title: Canva-Backer FPV Ventures Raises New $525 Million Fund
content: Wesley Chan, a former investor at Felicis Ventures, has raised a new venture capital fund along with Morgan Stanley alum Pegah Ebrahimi — bringing in $525 million for the second investment vehicle at their firm, FPV Ventures.

title: TDK Adds Risk Scenario to Downbeat Outlook Due to Tariff Threat
content: TDK Corp.’s revenue outlook fell well short of analysts’ estimates, reflecting the anticipated fallout from a global trade war on industries from cars to smartphones.

title: NATO-Backed German Startup Raises Funds for Military Robots
content: ARX Robotics, a German defense startup backed by NATO’s technology fund, has raised venture capital funding for the second time in the past year as it plans an expansion in the UK.

title: US Shoppers Pay for Trump Tariffs on Temu, Doubling Some Prices
content: Discount Chinese retail app Temu appears to be passing on nearly all of Donald Trump’s new import taxes to US consumers, more than doubling the cost of some products in a move that may add to concern about the inflationary impact of tariffs.

title: Data Centers Are Emerging in Malaysia’s Negeri Sembilan State
content: Malaysia’s Negeri Sembilan state is emerging as a new hub for data centers as the top market of Johor grapples with the facilities’ voracious consumption of energy and water.

title: Global Race to Lure US Researchers Intensifies as Trump Slashes Science Funding
content: A global race to recruit US scientists is heating up as President Donald Trump’s sweeping cuts to research funding and federal agencies trigger an exodus from the country’s research institutions.

title: Once a Fintech Star, UK Equity Crowdfunding Is in Limbo
content: Once one of fintech’s hottest trends, equity crowdfunding gave millions of retail investors a chance to strike gold by owning a stake in Europe’s buzziest startups. These days the sector seems to have lost its sparkle, with fewer companies using it to raise cash and sinking valuations leaving some early backers with a bitter taste.

title: Xiaomi-Backed Robot Vacuum Brand Roborock Is Said to Consider Hong Kong Listing
content: Robot vacuum maker Beijing Roborock Technology Co. is weighing a share sale in Hong Kong this year to raise as much as $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Huawei Set to Test Powerful AI Chip to Rival Nvidia’s, WSJ Says
content: China’s Huawei Technologies Co. is getting ready to test a new and powerful artificial intelligence processor that the company hopes can replace some products made by US-based Nvidia Corp., the Wall Street Journal reported.

title: Apple Begins Breaking Up Its AI Team With Robotics, Siri Changes
content: Apple has begun breaking up its AI and machine learning organization by moving pieces to other parts of the company. Also: Meta races to get smart glasses with a display out this year and new details on Apple’s plan to shift iPhone production to India. In other news, the Apple Watch’s blood-oxygen feature remains elusive in the US even as the company touts other health offerings.

title: PIF’s Sanabil Backs Mideast Tech Startup Planning For Saudi IPO
content: The venture capital arm of Saudi Arabia’s sovereign wealth fund has backed a $135 million fundraising round for technology firm iMENA Holding as the company plans for an initial public offering in the kingdom.

title: Global Military Spending Surges as Europe Tackles Russian Threat
content: Defense spending surged last year by the most since at least the end of the Cold War, according to data published Monday, with European countries rushing to bolster their security in the face of threats from Russia.

title: Petro’s ‘Vampire’ IMF Spat Sends Colombian Assets Tumbling
content: Colombian assets dropped after the International Monetary Fund paused access to an $8.1 billion credit line, adding to concerns about the South American country’s widening budget deficit.

title: Euro Rally Catches Bessent’s Eye as Bets for ECB Rate Cuts Grow
content: The euro’s rally is getting the attention of officials on both sides of the Atlantic, fueling expectations for deeper interest-rate reductions by the European Central Bank as the gains show little sign of slowing.

title: NYC’s Congestion Toll Raised $159 Million in the First Quarter
content: New York City’s congestion pricing toll pulled in $159 million in the first three months of the program as the Trump administration is pushing to end the controversial initiative.

title: ECB’s Rehn Sees Downside Risks to March Inflation Forecasts
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Olli Rehn said there’s a danger that inflation will dip below the 2% target due to the fallout from US trade levies, reiterating that this would be grounds to further lower interest rates.

title: ECB’s Guindos Warns of Disorderly Market Risk Amid Trade Turmoil
content: European Central Bank Vice President Luis de Guindos said that volatile financial markets must be watched closely amid the risk of declines spiraling out of control.

title: BRICS Seeks to Fill Void Left by G-20 as Trump’s Trade War Rages
content: Major emerging market nations are striving to turn the BRICS group into a global forum capable of addressing the economic and political chaos unleashed by Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: IBM Plans to Invest $150 Billion in US Over Next Five Years
content: International Business Machines Corp. plans to invest $150 billion in the US over the next five years, joining a cohort of companies that have announced spending commitments following President Donald Trump’s election and tariff threats.

title: Bessent Says ‘It’s Up to China to De-Escalate’ in Trade War
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent said “all aspects” of the US government are in contact with China but that it’s up to Beijing to take the first step in de-escalating the tariff fight with the US due to the imbalance of trade between the two nations.

title: India, UK Spar Over Key Issues as Trade Pact Nears Finish Line
content: Talks between the UK and India on a free trade agreement have entered the final stretch, with both sides now wrangling over five unresolved issues, according to an official in New Delhi familiar with the matter.

title: Israel Offers US Trade Concession in Effort to Avoid Tariff Pain
content: Israel plans to make a major regulatory concession to Washington in a bid to get a better deal from President Donald Trump over tariffs, Economy and Industry Minister Nir Barkat said.

title: India’s Strengthening Supply-Chain Position Lures Even China
content: I’m Chris Anstey, an economics editor in Boston. Today we’re looking at India’s rising place in supply chains. Send us feedback and tips to ecodaily@bloomberg.net. And if you aren’t yet signed up to receive this newsletter, you can do so here.

title: Trump Cuts Threaten Americans’ Safety Net Just as More Are Expected to Need It
content: As tariffs spur worries of an economic downturn, Americans are poised to face higher costs with fewer resources to rely on.

title: Trump and the Abstract Art of the Unilateral Deal
content: Donald Trump will mark his 100th day in office this week having upended the global trading system, provoked the specter of looming recessions for the US and world economies, and undermined the long-standing roles of the dollar and US Treasuries as safe havens. All these things are likely to cast a shadow over the next 100 days and beyond.

title: Chile Government Struggles to Convince Market of Fiscal Prudence
content: Chile’s quarterly fiscal report last week was designed to reassure investors that the budget deficit remains under tight control, even as the threat of a global trade war mounts. Not everyone was convinced.

title: Angola Mulls IMF Financing as Bond Yields Soar on Oil Slump
content: Angola held talks with the International Monetary Fund last week about possible financing packages, its finance minister said, as trade wars and a slump in energy prices effectively shut the oil producer out of international bond markets.

title: Trump China Tariffs Set to Unleash Supply Jolt on US Economy
content: President Donald Trump’s tariff onslaught has roiled Washington and Wall Street for nearly a month. If the trade war persists, the next upheaval will hit much closer to home.

title: Wall Street Sees Bessent Playing Safe on Debt After Market Chaos
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent’s debt-management team is expected to keep the department’s plans for sales of longer-dated securities steady, especially after recent swings in the $29 trillion market.

title: Philippines Aims to Lower US Tariff to Zero During Talks
content: The Philippines will seek to bring down its US tariff rate to zero from the 17% earlier announced by President Donald Trump during talks with officials in Washington, the Southeast Asian nation’s trade chief said.

title: Long Trade War May Further Hamper Singapore Growth, MAS Says
content: Singapore’s central bank warned a prolonged global trade war could pose even greater risks to growth and inflation, with the initial round of tariffs already set to hit 60% of the city-state’s exports to the US.

title: South Korea Rules Out Chance of Trade Deal With US Before June Election
content: South Korea sees no chance of clinching a comprehensive trade agreement with the US before a presidential election on June 3, Vice Industry Minister Park Sung-taek said Monday, citing the complexity of the issues involved and political uncertainties.

title: ECB to Mull Rate Hike by End of Year, Franklin Templeton Says
content: The European Central Bank will pivot to start considering an interest-rate hike by the end of this year, according to Franklin Templeton, as the region’s defense spending is likely to heat up the economy.

title: Fiscal Support Since Pandemic Still Boosting Inflation, ECB Says
content: Aid measures by euro-zone governments during the pandemic and the war in Ukraine will keep stoking inflation in the years ahead, the European Central Bank said.

title: China Vows Steps to Ease Exporters’ Pain as Trump’s Tariffs Hit
content: Chinese officials vowed to provide more support for exporters affected by US President Donald Trump’s tariffs, showing greater urgency to shore up the crucial sector while denying having had any trade talks with Washington.

title: Thailand Eyes More Pet Food, Rice Exports Amid China-US Standoff
content: Thailand is aiming to increase exports of pet food, rice and other processed food products to the US at the cost of Chinese shippers who are shut out of the prized market by a tariff wall.

title: US Shoppers Pay for Trump Tariffs on Temu, Doubling Some Prices
content: Discount Chinese retail app Temu appears to be passing on nearly all of Donald Trump’s new import taxes to US consumers, more than doubling the cost of some products in a move that may add to concern about the inflationary impact of tariffs.

title: SNB Cuts Limit Again for Banks to Get Full Interest on Reserves
content: The Swiss National Bank will lower the threshold factor for remunerating sight deposits again, making a minor adjustment to how much interest banks earn for parking cash at the institution.

title: ECB Prepares for June Cut With Tariffs Expected to Hurt Economy
content: European Central Bank officials are preparing to lower interest rates further, expecting lasting damage to the economy from US tariffs even if Donald Trump’s administration softens its stance in the weeks ahead.

title: Tourism Hot Spot Thailand Launches Digital Arrival Card for Foreign Visitors
content: Thailand will require foreign visitors to fill up a pre-departure digital form from May 1, a move that will make it easy for authorities to track travelers amid a broadening crackdown against human trafficking into Southeast Asia’s illegal cybercrime centers.

title: Ghana Central Banker Sees Inflation at Four-Year Low by December
content: Ghana’s central bank chief forecasts inflation in Africa’s biggest gold producer will slow further after the monetary authority raised borrowing costs and as the new government of President John Mahama cuts spending.

title: Genial, Warren Mull Stock-Trading Alliance With Banco do Brasil
content: Two Brazilian brokerages, Genial Investimentos Corretora de Valores Mobiliarios SA and Warren Corretora de Valores Mobiliarios e Cambio Ltda., are among firms mulling a partnership with Banco do Brasil SA to provide equity-trading services to individual investors, people familiar with the matter said.

title: Pirelli Sidelines Chinese Owner in Clash Over Firm Control
content: Pirelli & C. SpA took a first step to distance itself from its main investor, declaring on Monday that China’s Sinochem no longer has control over the Italian tiremaker.

title: 23andMe Bankruptcy Bid Deadline Extended as DNA Privacy Woes Linger
content: The sale of the bankrupt DNA data bank 23andMe is facing delays as the company tries to find a lead bidder that can quickly clear regulatory hurdles and guarantee customer privacy rules will be honored.

title: Bain Capital in Talks to Lead $2 Billion Investment in Insurance Broker Acrisure
content: A group led by Bain Capital’s special-situations arm is in talks to invest as much as $2 billion in insurance broker Acrisure, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Brussels Airport Cancels Tuesday Flight Departures on Strike
content: Brussels Airport is canceling all departing flights on Tuesday due to security and other ground staff participating in a nationwide strike, according to a statement on the airport operator’s website published Monday.

title: Merck KGaA’s $3.9 Billion Springworks Deal to Boost US Presence
content: Merck KGaA’s $3.9 billion deal to buy SpringWorks Therapeutics Inc. will expand the German conglomerate’s presence in the US at a time when many companies are seeking to increase investment in the country.

title: NFL’s Commanders Strike $3 Billion Stadium Deal to Return to DC
content: After nearly three decades of playing in Maryland, the Washington Commanders are headed back to the District of Columbia to build a new home at the site of RFK Stadium, where the club played until the mid-1990s.

title: Erste Group Weighs Buying 49% of Santander’s Polish Unit
content: Erste Group Bank AG is in talks to buy a major stake in Banco Santander SA’s Polish unit, seizing an opportunity to expand in one of Europe’s fastest-growing markets.

title: Wells Fargo Says CFPB Ends Consent Order Dating Back to 2018
content: Wells Fargo & Co. said the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau terminated a consent order dating back to 2018 related to the bank’s compliance risk-management program, the sixth such order ended this year.

title: Deliveroo Shares Jump After $3.6 Billion DoorDash Offer
content: Deliveroo Plc shares surged by more than 18% on Monday, the most since 2021, after the British delivery firm disclosed an acquisition offer from DoorDash Inc.

title: Komatsu Considers Price Hikes in the US in Response to Tariffs
content: Komatsu Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Takuya Imayoshi may raise prices in the US in response to tariffs, with the company projecting a 27% drop in operating profit this fiscal year because of the levies and the stronger yen.

title: Mediobanca Bid Fuels Italy’s ‘Game of Thrones’ Over Generali
content: Mediobanca SpA has launched a surprise takeover bid for the private banking arm of Assicurazioni Generali SpA, highlighting the insurance giant’s role as the center of gravity for Italy’s M&A frenzy.

title: Private Equity Firms Target Defense Assets Once Seen as Toxic
content: Private equity firms are scouring for investment opportunities in European defense, chasing the once shunned sector in an effort to benefit from a historic switch to military expansion in the region.

title: Italian Banking M&A Wave Is Sweeping UniCredit to Mediobanca
content: Italian finance has been in turmoil since late last year, with one new deal proposal chasing the next almost on a monthly basis.

title: Aston Villa Considers Selling Stake in Women’s Team
content: Premier League football club Aston Villa is considering the sale of a minority stake in its women’s team, according to people familiar with the situation.

title: Kuwait Petroleum to Buy 25% Stake in China’s Wanhua Chemical
content: Kuwait’s Petrochemical Industries Co. agreed to buy a 25% stake in Wanhua Chemical Group, marking the country’s latest foray into China.

title: India Concludes $7.4 Billion Deal With France to Buy Rafale Jets
content: India has signed a deal to buy 26 Rafale marine fighter jets from France, the defense ministry spokesperson said on Monday, strengthening the South Asian country’s naval presence and surveillance abilities in the Indian Ocean Region.

title: Even a Volvo Bestseller Presents Headaches for Returning CEO
content: Volvo Car AB’s EX30 is one of the best-selling electric cars in Europe right now, but its start in the American market has been a rocky one. The premium SUV is compact and, until now, has been built in China — points that have played against it in the US, where tariffs not only delayed its introduction but also made early deliveries less profitable.

title: Japanese Brokerages Struggle With Volatility Even Before Tariffs
content: Daiwa Securities Group Inc.’s profit slumped while SMBC Nikko Securities Inc. fell into the red as stock and bond trading revenue at the two Japanese brokerages dropped even before this month’s market turmoil.

title: China Re-Exports Record Monthly Volume of LNG on Weak Demand
content: China has re-exported more than 280,000 tons of liquefied natural gas so far in April, the highest volume ever in a single month, according to ship-tracking data compiled by Bloomberg.

title: Toyoda’s $42 Billion Buyout Plan Spurs Governance Questions
content: Toyota Motor Corp. Chairman Akio Toyoda’s bid to buy out Toyota Industries Corp. could pit him against Japan’s efforts to reform its corporate landscape by demanding more shareholder accountability from top businesses.

title: Toyota Industries Shares Surge on Akio Toyoda Buyout Proposal
content: Toyota Industries Corp. shares surged by their daily limit as investors scrambled to interpret what Toyota Motor Corp. Chairman Akio Toyoda’s proposal to buy out the company would mean for corporate governance at Japan’s largest business group.

title: Airbus to Assume Spirit Asset as Boeing Takes Back Supplier
content: Airbus SE agreed to take over some assets and sites from Spirit AeroSystems Holdings Inc., clearing the way for the struggling US aerospace supplier to be acquired back by its former parent Boeing Co.

title: Akeso Drops as Cancer Drug Trial Falls Short of Expectations
content: Akeso Inc. shares plunged as much as 19% in Hong Kong on Monday after preliminary data for its new cancer drug fell short of expectations despite outperforming a best-selling US rival.

title: China’s GEM Boosts Recycling of Niche Metals Caught in Trade War
content: GEM Co Ltd., a Chinese battery-materials producer, aims to ramp up its recycling capacity for niche metals that have been targeted in the trade war between the US and China.

title: China’s CMOC Elevates Ex-Glencore Trader as Top Execs Depart
content: China’s CMOC Group Ltd., one of the world’s fastest-growing miners, unveiled major management changes with the departure of its chairman and vice chair and the addition of four new senior executives — including former Glencore Plc trader Kenny Ives.

title: Xiaomi-Backed Robot Vacuum Brand Roborock Is Said to Consider Hong Kong Listing
content: Robot vacuum maker Beijing Roborock Technology Co. is weighing a share sale in Hong Kong this year to raise as much as $500 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Top-Performing India Fund Sounds Caution on Stocks, Raises Cash
content: Pricey valuations and fading hopes of robust earnings growth are leaving India’s equity market short of investible ideas for a money manager at a top-performing fund.

title: Behind the ‘60 Minutes’ Upheaval, a Big Merger Seeking Approval
content: Shari Redstone wanted to know what 60 Minutes was going to say next about President Donald Trump.

title: China Approves 10 New Reactors in Nuclear Power Ramp-Up
content: China’s State Council approved 10 new reactors on Sunday in a vote of confidence for nuclear power to remain central to the nation’s clean energy transition.

title: 7 Simple Steps to Improve Your Credit Score Fast
content: If you are wondering how to improve your credit score fast, the key lies in taking targeted actions that have immediate impact. Start by paying off

title: ‘King of All Pimps’ — who recruited then-NY Gov. Eliot Spitzer hooker Ashley Dupré — claims his reputation was trashed by murder claim
content: A notorious pimp who took credit for recruiting Ashley Dupré, the hooker whose tryst with then-Gov. Eliot Spitzer ended the "Luv Guv's" career, claims in a lawsuit that a YouTuber has ruined his rep.

title: The U.S. states where auto loan delinquency is rising the most
content: Falling behind on car payments can lead to repossession and long-term credit damage

title: How to prepare for credit card debt forgiveness this May
content: Credit card debt forgiveness can offer cardholders in debt critical help. Here's how to prepare this May.

title: $15 Amazon credit, $730 Apple Watch Ultra 2, $20 Kasa security cam, $119 Bose speaker, more
content: The hottest daily deals on Thursday include the Apple Watch Ultra 2, Kasa security cameras from TP-Link, Bose speakers, and more.

title: Canary Mission, the controversial organization targeting student activists, explained
content: This group keeps a pro-Israel blacklist. Now it’s taking credit for deportations.

title: Thunderbolts* credit scenes and asterisk meaning revealed
content: Following the premiere of Thunderbolts*, the film's two crazy plot leaks and the meaning behind the asterisk have leaked.

title: Wiz Khalifa takes credit for getting Snoop Dogg's kids stoned for the first time
content: The "Black and Yellow" rapper revealed that he smoked weed with Snoop Dogg’s sons Corde and Cordell during the filming of the musicians' 2012 stoner comedy “Mac & Devin Go to High School.”

title: A court in Ivory Coast removes a former Credit Suisse CEO from the presidential ballot
content: A lawyer says an Ivory Coast court has ruled that former Credit Suisse CEO Tidjane Thiam is not eligible to run for president because of his dual Ivorian-French nationality.

title: CA Film & TV Tax Credit Expansion Bill Clears State Assembly Committee
content: The California Senate is expected to vote AB1138's sister bill out of committee on Wednesday

title: Iran proposes meeting with European parties over 2015 nuclear deal
Court ruling favours Australia's Bega Cheese in dairy giant Fonterra's trademark dispute
India's Adani Green says independent review on US indictment found no irregularities
Shares in Mexico's Cemex's jump as Dominican asset sale propels profit
Investors fear Big Oil could cut share buybacks as crude prices slump
Analysis-Corporate America boosts security spending after UnitedHealth murder, filings show
FCC chair says 'all options' open in CBS '60 Minutes' news distortion review
European shares end higher ahead of week's data, earnings

Sabre to cut debt with $1.1 billion sale of hospitality software to TPG, shares jump

USA: Zollpolitik und Inflatiionssorgen belasten Michigan-Konsumklima deutlich

content:
Paul S. Atkins was sworn into office today as the 34th Chairman of the Securities and Exchange Commission.

Chairman Atkins was nominated by President Donald J. Trump on January 20, 2025, and confirmed by the U.S. Senate on April 9, 2025.

content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced an award of approximately $6 million to joint whistleblowers who provided new information that led to the opening of an examination and provided a roadmap for an enforcement action that resulted in…

title: SEC Small Business Advisory Committee to Explore Regulation A
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Small Business Capital Formation Advisory Committee announced that its meeting on Tuesday, May 6, 2025, will focus on the practical market considerations and regulatory challenges of Regulation A. Members of the…

title: SEC Announces Agenda, Panelists for Roundtable on Crypto Custody
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Crypto Task Force has announced the agenda and panelists for its April 25 roundtable, “Know Your Custodian: Key Considerations for Crypto Custody.”

title: SEC Extends Effective and Compliance Dates for Amendments to Investment Company Reporting Requirements
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a two-year extension of the effective and compliance dates for rule amendments adopted in August 2024 that require many types of registered funds to more frequently report portfolio-related…

title: SEC’s Anti-Fraud Public Service Campaign Warns Investors About Relationship Investment Scams
content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

title: SEC Publishes New Data and Analysis About Registered Investment Companies and Money Market Funds
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today published new data and analysis in a pair of reports that provide the investing public with updated key information about registered investment companies and money market funds.

title: SEC Announces Agenda, Panelists for Roundtable on Crypto Trading
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Crypto Task Force has announced the agenda and panelists for its April 11 roundtable, “Between a Block and a Hard Place: Tailoring Regulation for Crypto Trading.”

title: By Building Wealth, Investors Power U.S. Economy
content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

title: SEC Charges Three Arizona Individuals with Defrauding Investors in $284 Million Municipal Bond Offering That Financed Sports Complex
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged Randall “Randy” Miller, Chad Miller, and Jeffrey De Laveaga with creating false documents that were provided to investors in two municipal bond offerings that raised $284 million to build one of the…

title: SEC Votes to End Defense of Climate Disclosure Rules
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today voted to end its defense of the rules requiring disclosure of climate-related risks and greenhouse gas emissions.

SEC Acting Chairman Mark T. Uyeda said, “The goal of today’s Commission action and…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Four More Roundtables
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

title: SEC Announces Agenda, Panelists for Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the agenda and panelists for the March 27 roundtable on artificial intelligence in the financial industry.  

“I look forward to hearing from the panelists on how emerging technologies,…

title: SEC Charges New Jersey Investment Adviser and His Firm with Fraud and Other Violations
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that it has filed charges against David Yow Shang Chiueh of East Hanover, New Jersey and his investment advisory firm, Upright Financial Corp., for misconduct and for investing more than 25…

title: SEC Extends Compliance Dates for Amendments to Investment Company Names Rule
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced a six-month extension of the compliance dates for amendments adopted in September 2023 to the Investment Company Act “Names Rule,” which addresses fund names likely to mislead investors about a fund’…

title: SEC Charges Investment Adviser and Two Officers for Misuse of Fund and Portfolio Company Assets
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today filed settled charges against registered investment adviser Momentum Advisors LLC, its former managing partner Allan J. Boomer, and its former chief operating officer and partner Tiffany L. Hawkins, for…

title: Filer Transition to New and Improved EDGAR Begins March 24
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission is providing extensive guidance and resources to assist filers with upcoming access and account management enhancements to the security of the agency’s Electronic Data Gathering, Analysis, and Retrieval (EDGAR)…

title: SEC Crypto Task Force to Host Roundtable on Security Status
content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

title: SEC Staff Facilitates Capital Formation for Companies Planning Public Offerings
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that its Division of Corporation Finance is further facilitating capital formation by enhancing the accommodations available to companies for nonpublic review of draft registration statements.

In…

title: Commissioner Hester Peirce Announces Crypto Task Force Staff
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.



The task force is composed of staff from the Acting Chairman’s office and other divisions…

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: SEC Announces Dismissal of Civil Enforcement Action Against Coinbase
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced that the Commission has filed a joint stipulation with Coinbase Inc. and Coinbase Global Inc. to dismiss the ongoing civil enforcement action against the two entities.

title: SEC Charges Justinas Butkus with Orchestrating $4 Million Fraud
content: The Securities and Exchange Commission today filed charges against Justinas Butkus, of Lithuania, and two companies he owned and controlled, HMC Trading LLC and HMC Management LLC, for fraudulently raising approximately $4.1 million from 64 investors by…

title: SEC Investor Advisory Committee to Examine the Disclosure of AI’s Impact on Company Operations; and Retail Investor Fraud in America at March 6 Meeting
content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission’s Investor Advisory Committee will hold a public meeting at the SEC Headquarters in Washington, D.C., on March 6, at 10 a.m. ET. The meeting will also be webcast on the SEC website.

The committee will host two…

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Seed Funding Fell Hard In These Sectors
content: U.S. seed-stage investment actually declined a bit last year, particularly in a handful of industries including several beset by disappointing performance of startups funded in recent prior years. We take a look.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: A 'local top' and $88K retest? 5 things to know in Bitcoin this week
content:
Bitcoin (BTC) is bracing for a major US macro data week as crypto market participants warn of serious volatility next.

content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. cut its holdings in shares of Triple Flag Precious Metals Corp. (NYSE:TFPM – Free Report) by 8.3% during the 4th quarter, according to the company in its most recent filing w… [+5298 chars]
