title: Commerzbank Profit Unexpectedly Rises in Boost to CEO Orlopp
content: Commerzbank AG’s first-quarter profit unexpectedly rose to the highest in 14 years as commissions increased and the German lender set aside less money than expected for souring loans.

title: IAG Orders 71 Large Jets from Boeing, Airbus to Grow Network
content: IAG SA announced a major order for widebody jets, doubling down on a long-haul business with a $10 billion fleet investment to help sustain its earnings momentum.

title: US Equity Futures Waver Ahead of China Trade Talks: Markets Wrap
content: US equity futures were muted ahead of trade talks between the world’s two biggest economies, after a framework agreement with the UK stirred up optimism over more tariff relief.

title: Germany’s DAX Index Heads for Record, Erasing Tariff Retreat
content: Germany’s DAX Index became the first European gauge to surpass its March record high, recouping all declines sparked by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: FTSE 100 Live: UK Stocks Rise to Break Two-Day Losing Run
Safaricom Profit Jump Beats Estimates Despite Ethiopia Loss
content: Safaricom Plc climbed to an almost three-month high after the Kenyan telecommunications giant said annual profit rose 11%, exceeding analysts’ expectations despite losses in its new Ethiopia unit.

title: Zimbabweans Are Rushing Into Property as a Safe Haven Against a Volatile Economy
content: Zimbabweans are snapping up properties as a safe-haven against currency uncertainty and the frequent economic policy u-turns that have scared off investors, at a time when a popular hedge — the country’s stock market — is underperfoming.

title: Foreign Banks Sell Record Indian Sovereign Debt as Tensions Rise
content: Foreign banks sold a record amount of Indian government bonds Thursday, as a growing border conflict with Pakistan weighs on investor sentiment.

title: Hungary Inflation Slows Toward Central Bank’s Tolerance Band
content: Hungary’s consumer price growth slowed less than forecast last month, edging closer to the top end of the central bank’s tolerance band.

title: Oil Advances With Focus on US-China Trade Talks After UK Deal
content: Oil extended gains as the market turned its attention to trade talks between the US and China this weekend after President Donald Trump announced an agreement with the UK.

title: Trump's GCC Visit Seeks Business, Geopolitical Deals
content: President Trump is eyeing billions of dollars from wealth funds in the UAE, Saudi Arabia, and Qatar. Israel's normalization with Saudi Arabia is also expected to be on the agenda during Trump's visit to the Gulf states, but as Bloomberg's Sam Dagher and Dan Williams tell Joumanna Bercetche on Horizons Middle East & Africa, what the Saudis are pushing for could be opposed to the Israeli strategy at the moment.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: European Firms Voicing Uncertainty on Analyst Calls Reaches Peak
content: Europe’s companies are the least confident about the outlook in at least two decades as they try to navigate through the trade war.

title: Thai Billionaire’s Frasers Property Posts Higher Profit on Singapore Housing Business
content: Frasers Property Ltd., the developer controlled by Thai billionaire Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi, indicated it is still exploring opportunities in Shanghai and other Chinese cities despite the country’s ongoing property crisis.

title: Japan’s Top Hotels Under Scrutiny For Potential Price Collusion As Tourism Booms
content: A group of Japan’s top hotels, including Tokyo’s historic Imperial Hotel and New Otani, have been sharing rates information in a potential breach of anti-monopoly rules, the country’s antitrust watchdog said in a warning.

title: Abu Dhabi’s IHC, BlackRock Unveil $1 Billion Reinsurance Firm
content: International Holding Co., Abu Dhabi’s largest listed company led by a key member of the emirate’s royal family, is launching a $1 billion reinsurance venture with BlackRock Inc.

title: Gold Advances as Market Weighs Implications of US-UK Deal
content: Gold rose Friday — after a roller-coaster week in which it jumped almost 6% in the first two sessions before retracing much of those gains — as the market digested the new US-UK trade deal.

title: Hong Kong Property May Bottom as Borrowing Costs Drop, Jefferies Says
content: Declining interest rates in Hong Kong are increasing the chances the residential property market bottoms out, according to Jefferies.

title: Nordic Leaders Talk Prospect of Cease Fire With Trump, Zelenskiy
content: The Nordic, Baltic and Dutch government leaders have held talks with Donald Trump and Volodymyr Zelenskiy about the prospects of a cease fire in Ukraine.

title: Bloomberg: The Asia Trade 5/9/2025
content: "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade" brings you everything you need to know to get ahead as the trading day begins in Asia. Bloomberg TV is live from Tokyo and Sydney with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts, getting insight and analysis from newsmakers and industry leaders on the biggest stories shaping global markets. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Improving Earnings Set to Bolster India Stock Rally
content: India’s recent crop of corporate earnings is emerging as another positive catalyst that’s likely to help its nascent stock-market rally gather steam.

title: India’s Central Bank Ready to Stabilize Rupee as Currency Slips
content: India’s central bank doesn’t expect wild swings in the rupee but is ready to use foreign reserves to preserve currency stability as tensions with Pakistan escalate, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Chinese Stocks Slip as Investors Turn Cautious Before US Talks
content: Chinese shares edged lower as caution prevailed ahead of the closely watched weekend trade talks between the world’s two largest economies.

title: Private Credit Investors to Rejig Portfolios Amid Tariff Fears
content: Private credit investors are seeking to reshuffle their portfolios as the escalating global tariff war prompts mounting fears over allocations into the US.

title: China Teapots Make Rare Murban Oil Purchases for Quick Delivery
content: At least two independent Chinese refiners have made a rare foray into the broader international crude market, snapping up cargoes of Middle Eastern oil for delivery next month.

title: Wealth Manager Lures India Bankers With 60% Revenue Sharing
content: A $6 billion Indian money manager plans to ramp up hiring of senior bankers by allowing them to keep up to 60% of the revenue they bring in, showing how competition for talent is heating up in one of the world’s fastest growing wealth markets.

title: Global Shift to Bypass the Dollar Is Gaining Momentum in Asia
content: Banks and brokers are seeing rising demand for currency derivatives that bypass the dollar, as trade tensions add a sense of urgency to a years-long shift away from the greenback.

title: US Sanctions Third ‘Teapot’ Refinery in China Over Iran Oil
content: The US Treasury Department sanctioned an oil refinery in China — along with port terminal operators, vessels, companies and individuals — it accuses of facilitating the Iranian crude trade, which it said funds Tehran’s military and violates existing US sanctions.

title: Logistics Firm GLP Raises $300 Million in New Bond, Reports Loss
content: Asian logistics property developer GLP Pte. has sold a three-year $300 million bond, returning to the debt market after a recent canceled sale as it faces a $1 billion note coming due.

title: Sakana AI CEO on Tariffs, Japan's AI Landscape
content: David Ha, CEO at Sakana AI, discusses the impact from the US trade tariffs and the outlook for Japan's  AI landscape. He speaks with Shery Ahn and Haidi Stroud-Watts from the sidelines of the "SusHi Tech Tokyo" conference on "Bloomberg: The Asia Trade". (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Makino Milling Shares Sink as Nidec Abandons Takeover Bid
content: Shares of Makino Milling Machine Co. tumbled as much as 21% on Friday, the most on record, after Nidec Corp. withdrew its unsolicited takeover bid for the Japanese machine tool maker.

title: How White Sox Fan ‘Bob’ Beat the Odds to Become First US Pope
content: He was known just as Bob, a White Sox fan from the South Side of Chicago. Now mild-mannered cardinal Robert Francis Prevost has been declared Leo XIV, and his predecessor sowed the seeds for his ascent.

title: Starmer Gets Needed Diplomatic Win, If Not an Economic Boost
content: The UK’s achievement in becoming the first country to strike a trade deal with Donald Trump in the wake of his tariff onslaught marked a political win for Prime Minister Keir Starmer vindicating his “softly, softly” approach to the US president. But the economic benefits for Britain may be more limited — and the agreement offers a sign of things to come for other nations trying to avoid a global trade war.

title: Germany Says Trump and Merz Agree on Need for Trade Deal
content: Germany’s new chancellor, Friedrich Merz, and US President Donald Trump agreed that trade disputes should be resolved quickly and discussed the need for close cooperation between the two nations.

title: Trump Team Seeks Tariff Cuts, Rare Earths Relief in China Talks
content: The Trump administration is weighing a dramatic tariff reduction during weekend talks with China to de-escalate tensions and temper the economic pain both are already starting to feel.

title: Xi Tells Putin to Reach ‘Fair’ Peace Deal to End War on Ukraine
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping said he hopes to see a “fair” peace deal on Ukraine, the latest move in his balancing act to mend ties with Europe in the face of a de facto trade embargo from the US.

title: The Ultra-Rich Move in Herds. Just Ask London.
content: If the campaign against abolition of the “non-dom” regime is measured by the volume of noise on each side, then the verdict is already in.

title: US Sanctions Third ‘Teapot’ Refinery in China Over Iran Oil
content: The US Treasury Department sanctioned an oil refinery in China — along with port terminal operators, vessels, companies and individuals — it accuses of facilitating the Iranian crude trade, which it said funds Tehran’s military and violates existing US sanctions.

title: India Says It Thwarted Pakistan Air Strikes as Tensions Soar
content: India said it “neutralized” Pakistani drone and missile attacks targeting several military sites on Thursday night, marking an escalation in hostilities between the two nuclear-armed neighbors.

title: North Korea Says Missile Tests Aimed to Simulate Nuclear Strikes
content: North Korea’s latest short-range missile tests aimed to simulate nuclear attacks on the US and South Korea, Pyongyang’s state media said Friday.

title: Lutnick Warns No 'Fast Deals' for Japan and South Korea
content: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that trade deals with South Korea and Japan could take significantly more time to complete than the framework agreement President Donald Trump announced Thursday with the UK, in a signal that some Asian partners may have to wait for tariff relief.

title: Trump Taps Fox News’ Pirro as DC Prosecutor, Moves Martin to DOJ
content: President Donald Trump announced he was appointing Fox News host Jeanine Pirro as the interim US Attorney for the District of Columbia, after pulling the nomination of Ed Martin amid congressional opposition.

title: London Mayor Plans to Build on Green Belt to End Housing Crisis
content: Mayor of London Sadiq Khan will “actively explore” building on the city’s green belt in what would amount to the biggest change to housing policy in the UK capital since the 1960s.

title: UK to Sanction Up to 100 Oil Tankers in Russia’s Shadow Fleet
content: The UK will sanction as many as 100 oil tankers that it says are part of a shadow fleet of vessels helping Russia to move its oil.

title: Asia’s Super-Rich Rapidly Scale Back US Exposure on Trade War
content: Some of Asia’s richest families are cutting exposure to US assets, saying President Donald Trump’s tariffs have made the world’s largest economy much less predictable.

title: Republicans Discussing Raising SALT Cap to $30,000, Johnson Says
content: House Speaker Mike Johnson said Republicans are discussing raising the state and local tax deduction cap to $30,000 — among other options — as the party seeks to resolve disagreements on the details of President Donald Trump’s tax package.

title: Marcos-Duterte Feud at Center of Philippine Midterm Elections
content: Philippine Vice President Sara Duterte won’t be on the ballot in Monday’s midterm elections, but the outcome could determine whether she keeps her job in a high-stakes contest centered around a feud between the country’s two most powerful families.

title: Trump’s UK Trade Framework Leaves Many Key Details for Later
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Today, senior editor Joe Sobczyk looks at the president’s announcement of an agreement on trade with the UK. Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.

title: Trump Seeks Tax Hike on Wealthy Earning $2.5 Million or More
content: President Donald Trump is pushing lawmakers to increase tax rates on some of the wealthiest Americans as a way to offset other cuts in his signature economic package.

title: Silicon Valley Is Coming for the Pentagon’s $1 Trillion Budget
content: The Trump administration wants startups to remake the US military, setting the stage for a battle over the world’s biggest defense budget.

title: Trump Calls for 30 Day Ceasefire Between Ukraine and Russia
content: President Donald Trump called for a 30-day ceasefire between Russia and Ukraine to pave the way for talks on a lasting peace agreement, and threatened to impose further sanctions if a truce is violated.

title: Immigration Raid on Paulson Puerto Rico Hotel Ensnares 53 People
content: An immigration raid on a luxury Puerto Rico hotel partially owned by billionaire investor John Paulson led the US Department of Homeland Security to arrest dozens of construction workers from the Dominican Republic.

title: Crypto-Backed Stablecoin Bill Blocked Amid Furor Over Trump Memecoin
content: Senate Democrats blocked stablecoin legislation backed by the digital assets industry amid a furor over President Donald Trump’s extensive and growing portfolio of crypto ventures.

title: ‘Incensed’ Columbia Chief Blasts Protesters After 80 Arrests
content: The crackdown was swift and the message was unequivocal: Columbia University has little tolerance for protesters who spark chaos on campus.

title: US Unveils Plans to Fast-Track Deals as Trump Eyes Mideast Funds
content: The US said it’s developing a fast-track process for screening foreign investments in the US, an effort Trump administration officials expect could smooth the way for billions from wealth funds in the United Arab Emirates, Saudi Arabia and Qatar.

title: Trump’s UK Trade Deal Leaves Key Issues Unresolved
content: President Donald Trump pitched his trade framework with the UK as a historic achievement, and the first step in his revolutionary effort to overhaul the global economy.

title: Powell Gets Support From Bank of Canada’s Macklem Amid Trump Attacks
content: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem offered support to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell from US President Donald Trump’s attacks, as the Canadian policymaker called the independence of central banks “sacrosanct.”

title: Putin-Trump Meeting Is Getting Closer, Kremlin Aide Says
content: A meeting between Russian President Vladimir Putin and his US counterpart, Donald Trump, is getting closer, according to the Kremlin’s top foreign policy aide.

title: Duffy Pitches Six New Air Traffic Control Centers After Mishaps
content: US Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy called for the construction of six new air traffic control centers and the replacement of more than 600 radars in a broad proposal to overhaul the country’s aging system that manages some 45,000 flights each day.

title: Auto Parts Maker Linamar Emerges as Surprise Winner From Trump’s Tariffs
content: Canadian auto parts maker Linamar Corp., once thought to be a casualty of President Donald Trump’s tariffs on cars and metals, says it’s now a possible beneficiary of the trade war.

title: Health Crisis Deepens in Colombia as Hospitals Shut Down Units
content: The cash crunch in Colombia’s health system is forcing hospitals in the nation’s capital to close down units in order to focus efforts on other services.

title: Landlord LondonMetric Buys Urban Logistics in £699 Million Deal
content: LondonMetric Property Plc agreed to buy Urban Logistics Reit Plc in a deal valuing the company at about £699 million ($925 million).

title: Trump Team Mulls China Tariff Cut, New Pope Elected, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 6:43

title: American Cardinal Prevost Becomes Pope Leo XIV
content: Robert Francis Prevost, a 69-year-old cardinal from Chicago, has been declared Pope Leo XIV. Pope Francis elevated him to cardinal in 2023. When Leo XIV spoke to crowds from the balcony of St. Peter’s Basilica, his first message was against all forms of division and war. Bloomberg’s Chiara Albanese reports.

title: Commerzbank CEO Orlopp on Earnings, Guidance, Merz
content: Commerzbank AG Chief Executive Officer Bettina Orlopp discusses the bank’s forward guidance after reporting first-quarter profit which unexpectedly rose 12% from a year earlier to €834 million ($936 million), well ahead of analysts’ estimates. Speaking on Bloomberg Television, Orlopp also comments on German Chancellor Friedrich Merz’s new government and the outlook for Italian rival UniCredit SpA’s possible interest in buying the firm.

title: Macquarie CEO Says Tech Push in Bank Brings Profits, Staff Drop
content: Macquarie Group Ltd. Chief Executive Officer Shemara Wikramanayake expects a years-long push to invest in technology within its banking and financial services division to reap further gains. It’s also resulted in lower staff levels.

title: What to Expect From Trump’s Visit to the Middle East
content: US President Donald Trump is set to visit Saudi Arabia, Qatar and the United Arab Emirates next week. Bloomberg’s Sam Dagher and Dan Williams discuss what to expect from Trump’s visit to the Middle East and what this may mean in the broader geopolitical context.

title: Japan, South Korea Trade Deals May Take Time: Lutnick
content: Good morning. The US indicates it’s focusing on a big country for its next trade deal. Trump seeks a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine. And Apple is developing specialized chips for glasses. Listen to the day’s top stories.

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Europe: US Eyes China Tariff Cut (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 17:30

title: US Eyes China Tariff Cut, First American Pope, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 6:16

title: Japan’s Top Hotels Under Scrutiny For Potential Price Collusion As Tourism Booms
content: A group of Japan’s top hotels, including Tokyo’s historic Imperial Hotel and New Otani, have been sharing rates information in a potential breach of anti-monopoly rules, the country’s antitrust watchdog said in a warning.

title: Trump Sounds Conciliatory Tone Toward EU After UK Deal
content: Welcome to the Brussels Edition, Bloomberg’s daily briefing on what matters most in the heart of the European Union.

title: Romania’s Politics Spooks Its Currency
content: Hi, this is Irina Vilcu in Bucharest. Welcome to our weekly newsletter on what’s shaping economics and investments from the Baltic Sea to the Balkans. You can subscribe here.

title: China-US Trade Talk Déjà Vu Hints at More Turmoil Ahead
content: Hi, this is John Liu in Beijing — where seven years ago this month, I was staking out the lobby of Chaoyang Westin Hotel before dawn, waiting to fire questions at Trump administration officials as they prepared to kick off the first round of US-China trade talks.

title: Singapore’s Richest Clan Fails in Bid to Buy Out NZ Hotel Unit
content: City Developments Ltd. failed in a bid to buy out its listed New Zealand hotel unit, in another setback for the embattled Singapore developer.

title: UK Sewage Crisis Leaves Beachgoers Sick and Frustrated
content: Swimmers are falling seriously ill from Britain’s polluted waters, with leaks still getting worse, not better.

title: The Ultra-Rich Move in Herds. Just Ask London.
content: If the campaign against abolition of the “non-dom” regime is measured by the volume of noise on each side, then the verdict is already in.

title: First American Elected as Pope, US-UK Trade Framework, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 4:34

title: Global Shift to Bypass the Dollar Is Gaining Momentum in Asia
content: Banks and brokers are seeing rising demand for currency derivatives that bypass the dollar, as trade tensions add a sense of urgency to a years-long shift away from the greenback.

title: Putin and Xi Take Aim at US-Led Order
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin and Chinese President Xi Jinping held bilateral meetings in Moscow, emphasizing an alliance they claim will create a multipolar world order. Xi’s four-day trip to Moscow started on Wednesday and coincides with Russia’s 80th-anniversary commemorations of the end of World War II. Leaders from more than 20 countries, including Brazilian President Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva, are due to attend. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump on Pope Leo XIV, Optimistic About China Trade Talks, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 4:55

title: Elon, Inc: Robot Besties and Movie Tariffs (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 33:46

title: Trump Reacts to New Pope Leo XIV, Announces UK Trade Deal, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 4:60

title: Bloomberg Daybreak Asia: Trade Talk Optimism Caps Week (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 20:24

title: Leo XIV Elected as First American Pope, US-UK Trade Deal, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 5:03

title: Urban Revivo Founder Leo Li on Tariff Impacts, US Expansion
content: Chinese apparel brand Urban Revivo will continue its US expansion despite the tariffs against China hit its margins. Founder and CEO Leo Li says the company hasn't raised retail prices as it still has big room to bear the tariff burdens as China's supply chain is still competitive in the US and Europe. Li spoke exclusively with Bloomberg TV's Minmin Low. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Announces Trade Framework with UK | Balance of Power: Late Edition 05/08/2025
content: "Balance of Power" focuses on the intersection of politics and global business. On the show today, US Commerces Secretary Howard Lutnick, Former UK Ambassador Peter Westmacott, Former Representative (D) California, Jane Harman, Republican Main Street Partnership President and CIO Sarah Chamberlain, and HG Creative Vice President Kevin Walling. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: American Pope Elected, Stocks Rally on Trade Deal, More
content: Source: Bloomberg, 4:58

title: Ryan Reynolds’ MNTN Weighs IPO Launch Soon as Next Week
content: Connected TV advertising platform MNTN Inc. is considering launching its initial public offering as soon as next week, according to people familiar with the matter, after delaying its plans amid tariff-induced market volatility.

title: Stock Movers: Lyft, AppLovin, Coinbase (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 6:16

title: Bloomberg Businessweek Daily: First American Pope (Podcast)
content: Source: Bloomberg, 44:29

title: Sunil Mittal Is Said Poised to Buy $2 Billion Stake in Haier India
content: Sunil Mittal is in advanced talks to acquire a 49% stake in the Indian unit of China’s Haier Smart Home Co., according to people familiar with the matter, as the billionaire looks to tap growing demand for goods such as home appliances in the South Asian country.

title: Ex-Northvolt CEO Gets New Funds for AI Startup in Manufacturing
content: Two former executives from bankrupt battery maker Northvolt AB have launched a new venture in Sweden that will utilize artificial intelligence to help manufacturing processes.

title: TSMC April Sales Surge After US Tariffs Spur Device Rush Orders
content: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s revenue jumped 48% in April, underscoring how electronics firms scrambled to acquire essential components before global tariffs took effect.

title: China’s Top Chipmaker SMIC Plunges After Projecting Lower Sales
content: Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. plunged Friday after China’s leading chipmaker warned sales could fall as much as 6% this quarter because of production disruptions.

title: NTT Announces 200 Billion Yen Buyback in Capital Efficiency Push
content: Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. said it plans to buy back as much as ¥200 billion ($1.4 billion) of its shares, joining a growing string of such measures bolstering the Japanese market.

title: At OpenAI, Fidji Simo to Bring Lessons From Instacart and Meta
content: Simo has been appointed CEO of applications at OpenAI, where she will oversee executives and broaden the company's hit chatbot, ChatGPT, into a Swiss Army knife of artificial intelligence software.

title: Taiwan’s Exports Surge to Record, Fueling Currency Gains
content: Taiwan’s exports climbed to a record in the year through April, driven by a rush to ship goods ahead of US tariffs and continued strong demand for the island’s tech products.

title: Nidec Withdraws $1.8 Billion Hostile Bid for Makino Milling
content: Nidec Corp. is withdrawing a ¥257 billion ($1.8 billion) unsolicited tender offer for machine tool maker Makino Milling Machine Co., bowing to strong resistance from its target.

title: Ryan Reynolds’ MNTN Weighs IPO Launch Soon as Next Week
content: Connected TV advertising platform MNTN Inc. is considering launching its initial public offering as soon as next week, according to people familiar with the matter, after delaying its plans amid tariff-induced market volatility.

title: Celsius Founder Mashinsky Gets 12 Years for Crypto Fraud
content: Alex Mashinsky, the founder of cryptocurrency lender Celsius Network, was ordered to spend 12 years in prison for defrauding hundreds of thousands of customers lured by his firm’s high interest rates on digital-asset deposits.

title: Pinterest Surges as AI Expected to Lure Advertiser Spending
content: Pinterest Inc. surged in extended trading after second-quarter revenue guidance topped estimates at the midpoint, further easing concerns of an advertising slowdown.

title: From Apple to GM, Tariffs to Cost Companies Tens of Billions
content: From Apple Inc. to General Motors Co., corporate America is bracing for tens of billions of dollars in damages from Trump’s trade war — and that’s before most affected goods have landed.

title: Coinbase Posts Jump in Revenue, Drop in Quarterly Earnings
content: Coinbase Global Inc.’s first-quarter revenue jumped while profit declined as the largest US crypto exchange navigated the volatile price swings of the digital asset market.

title: Trump to End Biden-Era Program to Bridge Digital Divide
content: President Donald Trump said he would end a program that provides billions to extend internet access in underserved communities, casting it as unfairly providing grants on the basis of race.

title: Silicon Valley Is Coming for the Pentagon’s $1 Trillion Budget
content: The Trump administration wants startups to remake the US military, setting the stage for a battle over the world’s biggest defense budget.

title: Adobe to Cut Software Price for US Government After DOGE Review
content: Adobe Inc. will offer a package of its products to the government at a discounted rate following scrutiny on software spending by the Trump administration.

title: BCE Cuts Dividend by 56%, Strikes Fiber Deal With PSP
content: BCE Inc. cut its dividend for the first time in 17 years and unveiled a deal with a Canadian pension fund to help finance growth in Ziply, the US broadband provider it’s trying to acquire.

title: Big Tech Is on Trial. What That Means for the Future of the Internet
content: Today on the Big Take podcast: Will the antitrust cases against Google and Meta help innovation flourish, or kill America’s chances at AI dominance?

title: Lyft Posts Bookings and Outlook Beat, Expands Buybacks
content: Lyft Inc. reported better-than-expected gross bookings in the first quarter, drawing a sharp contrast with the disappointing results issued by its much-larger ride-hailing rival Uber Technologies Inc. a day earlier.

title: Crypto-Backed Stablecoin Bill Blocked Amid Furor Over Trump Memecoin
content: Senate Democrats blocked stablecoin legislation backed by the digital assets industry amid a furor over President Donald Trump’s extensive and growing portfolio of crypto ventures.

title: Instagram Chief Says App Has Feared TikTok Threat for Years
content: A small portion of Instagram’s content comes from users engaging with family and friends as the app focuses more on video offerings to compete with TikTok, the platform’s chief Adam Mosseri said, seeking to fend off government claims that Meta Platforms Inc. monopolizes social media.

title: Consumer Watchdog Halts Biden-Era Google Payment Supervision
content: The Consumer Financial Protection Bureau discontinued its order designating the supervision of Alphabet Inc.’s Google Payment Corp., reversing a Biden-era decision to monitor the nonbank financial platform.

title: Podcast Deals Heat Up Again in Wake of Trump’s Victory
content: As the linear TV business falters, broadcasters are eyeing podcasters while investors pump cash into independent networks

title: Apple Is Developing Specialized Chips for Glasses, New Macs and AI Servers
content: Apple Inc.’s silicon design group is working on new chips that will serve as the brains for future devices, including its first smart glasses, more powerful Macs and artificial intelligence servers.

title: Bitcoin Retakes $100,000 Amid an Easing of Global Trade Tensions
content: Bitcoin crossed the $100,000 threshold for the first time since February, fueled by expectations for an easing of global trade tensions.

title: Meta Taps New Head of AI Lab After Staffer’s Return From Google
content: Meta Platforms Inc. told staff that it’s chosen Robert Fergus to helm its artificial intelligence research lab, elevating an employee who helped start the lab before a stint at competitor Alphabet Inc.

title: Tech Executives Urge Senators to Rethink Regulations for AI
content: The leaders of some of the biggest technology and artificial intelligence companies appeared before Congress on Thursday with a wish list of sorts that at its top has doing away with regulations they say inhibit their firms’ growth and, by default, sends business to China.

title: Shopify Falls on Narrowing Profit as It Spends to Boost Revenue
content: Shopify Inc. shares fell after the company projected slowing profit growth in the current quarter, with executives pledging to keep spending to boost sales growth.

title: Arm Tumbles After Weak Forecast, Spurring Slowdown Fears
content: Arm Holdings Plc declined in Thursday trading after giving a disappointing sales forecast for the current quarter, stoking concerns about a tariff-fueled slowdown for the chip industry.

title: MercadoLibre Gains on Earnings Marked by Argentina Rebound
content: E-commerce and fintech giant MercadoLibre Inc. rallied after first quarter earnings beat analyst expectations led by a stronger-than-expected rebound in Argentina.

title: Norway Core Inflation Slows More Than Seen, Fueling Rate Bet
content: Norway’s underlying inflation slowed more than forecast last month, fueling odds of an interest-rate cut by Norges Bank before the fall.

title: Hungary Inflation Slows Toward Central Bank’s Tolerance Band
content: Hungary’s consumer price growth slowed less than forecast last month, edging closer to the top end of the central bank’s tolerance band.

title: Trump Team Seeks Tariff Cuts, Rare Earths Relief in China Talks
content: The Trump administration is weighing a dramatic tariff reduction during weekend talks with China to de-escalate tensions and temper the economic pain both are already starting to feel.

title: Chinese Exports to US Slump 21% But Soar to Asia and Europe
content: China’s exports rose more than forecast in April even as shipments to the US slumped sharply in the first month after President Donald Trump targeted its goods with tariffs above 100%.

title: Hong Kong Property May Bottom as Borrowing Costs Drop, Jefferies Says
content: Declining interest rates in Hong Kong are increasing the chances the residential property market bottoms out, according to Jefferies.

title: China Is Said Seeking Argentina Crops as It Skirts US Tariffs
content: China signed a letter of intent with exporters in Argentina to buy about $900 million of soybeans, corn and vegetable oil, the latest indication that the Asian nation will avoid sourcing from the US during President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Japan’s Slower Wage and Export Growth Backs Case for BOJ Caution
content: Gains in Japan’s wages cooled more than expected in March while early trade figures for April showed export growth slowing, adding to the case for the Bank of Japan to proceed cautiously with interest-rate hikes as economic risks at home and abroad continue to mount.

title: Japan’s Early Exports in April Slow as US Tariffs Hit Firms
content: Japan’s exports slowed in the first 20 days of April as the US tariff campaign intensified with new car and across-the-board levies.

title: Taiwan’s Exports Surge to Record, Fueling Currency Gains
content: Taiwan’s exports climbed to a record in the year through April, driven by a rush to ship goods ahead of US tariffs and continued strong demand for the island’s tech products.

title: Lutnick Warns No 'Fast Deals' for Japan and South Korea
content: Commerce Secretary Howard Lutnick said that trade deals with South Korea and Japan could take significantly more time to complete than the framework agreement President Donald Trump announced Thursday with the UK, in a signal that some Asian partners may have to wait for tariff relief.

title: Colombian Inflation Surprises All Analysts With April Jump
content: Colombian inflation unexpectedly jumped in April in an unwelcome surprise for policymakers who restarted monetary easing last week.

title: Peru Cuts Rate to 4.5% With Slow Inflation, Tariff Risks
content: Peru resumed monetary easing with inflation firmly under control and US tariffs posing mounting risks to its economy.

title: Asia’s Super-Rich Rapidly Scale Back US Exposure on Trade War
content: Some of Asia’s richest families are cutting exposure to US assets, saying President Donald Trump’s tariffs have made the world’s largest economy much less predictable.

title: How Albanese’s Australia Fits Into Trump’s New World Order
content: On this week’s Australia Podcast: Rebecca Jones speaks with a panel of Bloomberg experts about what’s next for the country in the era of Anthony Albanese and Donald Trump

title: Brazil Lifts Interest Rate to Nearly Two-Decade High of 14.75%
content: Brazil’s real rallied after the central bank kept its options open for another interest rate hike amid above-target inflation and global economic uncertainty.

title: Trump’s UK Trade Deal Leaves Key Issues Unresolved
content: President Donald Trump pitched his trade framework with the UK as a historic achievement, and the first step in his revolutionary effort to overhaul the global economy.

title: Powell Gets Support From Bank of Canada’s Macklem Amid Trump Attacks
content: Bank of Canada Governor Tiff Macklem offered support to Federal Reserve Chair Jerome Powell from US President Donald Trump’s attacks, as the Canadian policymaker called the independence of central banks “sacrosanct.”

title: If UK-US Trade Pact Is a Win, What's a Loss?
content: This all feels like the end of the beginning, rather than the beginning of the end.

title: Trump Hails UK Trade Framework as First of Many Tariff Deals
content: President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with the UK, hailing it as a “breakthrough” that US officials hoped would unlock other deals to expand market access for American goods.

title: Three-Year Inflation Views at Highest Since 2022 in Fed Survey
content: Americans’ expectations for inflation in the medium-term climbed to an almost three-year high in April while their views on the job market worsened, according to a monthly survey from the Federal Reserve Bank of New York.

title: UK Homeowners Can Thank Trump for Nudging BOE Toward a Rate Cut
content: US President Donald Trump’s trade policy is upending long-held alliances, threatening global growth and causing mayhem for business. For UK homeowners, though, it is working out quite well.

title: Despite Trump's Criticism, Powell Keeps Congress on His Side
content: Under relentless attack from President Donald Trump, Jerome Powell needs all the allies he can get — and he has plenty in Congress, including among Republicans who show little appetite for ditching the Federal Reserve chief.

title: Trump Says ‘Substantive’ China Talks Could Yield Tariff Cut
content: US President Donald Trump said he believed trade negotiations launching this weekend with China would result in tangible progress, predicting Beijing would be willing to make concessions and saying he could consider cutting punishing tariffs against the country if there was significant momentum.

title: Mortgage Rates in US Stay Stuck at 6.76%
content: Mortgage rates in the US stayed put at levels reached last week, keeping the pressure high for homebuyers.

title: How Trade War Can Elevate Mortgage Stress in Canada, in Charts
content: The Bank of Canada warned that a severe and long-lasting global trade war may cause more mortgage borrowers to fall behind on their payments — even beyond levels reached in the global financial crisis.

title: Nigeria Pays Off IMF’s $3.4 Billion Covid Loan to Exit Debt List
content: Nigeria has paid off $3.4 billion borrowed from the International Monetary Fund during the Covid-19 pandemic, exiting the list of countries that are in debt to the Washington-based lender.

title: Chile Annual Inflation Slows as Policymakers Keep Guard Against Price Pressures
content: Chile’s annual inflation eased past all forecasts last month in good news for policymakers who had warned they’re not out of the woods yet on fears of near-term price pressures and a more turbulent global economy.

title: Trump Says He’ll Raise Jimmy Lai’s Case in China Trade Talks
content: President Donald Trump said he will raise the case of ex-media mogul Jimmy Lai as part of US trade talks with China, a move likely to antagonize Beijing just days before the two sides meet.

title: Wall Street's A-List Worries About the Economy in Private, While Showing Public Calm
content: Attendees of this week’s Milken Institute Global Conference heard a lot of upbeat chatter from the stages of the Beverly Hilton hotel, where billionaires and executives frequently took a sanguine tone about the state of markets and the global economy.

title: ECB Officials Briefed on Military Threat Posed by Putin’s Russia
content: The European Central Bank Governing Council was given an in-depth analysis of the risks posed by potential Russian military aggression in eastern Europe at the start of its last rate-setting meeting, according to people familiar with the discussion.

title: Landlord LondonMetric Buys Urban Logistics in £699 Million Deal
content: LondonMetric Property Plc agreed to buy Urban Logistics Reit Plc in a deal valuing the company at about £699 million ($925 million).

title: Oil Advances With Focus on US-China Trade Talks After UK Deal
content: Oil extended gains as the market turned its attention to trade talks between the US and China this weekend after President Donald Trump announced an agreement with the UK.

title: Monte Paschi, Mediobanca Profits Beat as Investors Eye Deals
content: Banca Monte dei Paschi di Siena SpA joined rival Mediobanca SpA in posting higher than expected profits during the first three months of the year, as investors are focused on their respective acquisition plans.

title: Thai Billionaire’s Frasers Property Posts Higher Profit on Singapore Housing Business
content: Frasers Property Ltd., the developer controlled by Thai billionaire Charoen Sirivadhanabhakdi, indicated it is still exploring opportunities in Shanghai and other Chinese cities despite the country’s ongoing property crisis.

title: Japan’s Top Hotels Under Scrutiny For Potential Price Collusion As Tourism Booms
content: A group of Japan’s top hotels, including Tokyo’s historic Imperial Hotel and New Otani, have been sharing rates information in a potential breach of anti-monopoly rules, the country’s antitrust watchdog said in a warning.

title: China Teapots Make Rare Murban Oil Purchases for Quick Delivery
content: At least two independent Chinese refiners have made a rare foray into the broader international crude market, snapping up cargoes of Middle Eastern oil for delivery next month.

title: Fiera’s Desjardins to Step Down as CEO, Succeeded by Menard
content: Fiera Capital Corp. founder Jean-Guy Desjardins is stepping down as chief executive officer and will be succeeded by Maxime Menard, who currently heads the firm’s Canada unit.

title: Sweetgreen Cuts Outlook With Diners Reducing Salad Budgets
content: Sweetgreen Inc. cut its annual guidance, citing a sharp decline in consumer sentiment following the announcement of new tariffs in the US.

title: From Apple to GM, Tariffs to Cost Companies Tens of Billions
content: From Apple Inc. to General Motors Co., corporate America is bracing for tens of billions of dollars in damages from Trump’s trade war — and that’s before most affected goods have landed.

title: Speedcast Mulls Breakup, Sale of Ground Stations Unit
content: Speedcast, a provider of satellite communications and information technology services, is considering a sale of its ground stations business for more than $1 billion, people with knowledge of the matter said.

title: CIP to Invest $500 Million in BKV Carbon Capture Joint Venture
content: BKV Corp. and a clean energy-focused investment fund of Copenhagen Infrastructure Partners have agreed to form a joint venture to expand carbon-capture projects in the US.

title: Illumina Cuts Guidance on Threat From Tariffs and China Ban
content: Illumina Inc. cut its full-year adjusted profit guidance for the second time in three months as it grapples with the impact of tariffs and China banning imports of its gene-sequencing machines.

title: Mattel Names Paul Ruh CFO, Replacing Anthony DiSilvestro
content: Mattel Inc. has appointed Paul Ruh as chief financial officer, succeeding Anthony DiSilvestro.

title: Costco in Deal With Affirm Giving Shoppers Monthly Payment Plans
content: Costco Wholesale Corp. is tapping Affirm Holdings Inc. to let the retailer’s online shoppers pay over time for a transaction, an option that’s been helping many merchants sell bigger-ticket items and gives consumers more comfort in buying them.

title: British Airways Parent to Buy 30 Boeing Jets in Win for US
content: British Airways parent IAG SA is poised to order about 30 Boeing Co. 787 Dreamliner aircraft, according to people familiar with the matter, as the US planemaker snags an early win under President Donald Trump’s new trade deal with the UK.

title: Oil Advances as US Trade Deal With UK Stokes Risk-On Appetite
content: Oil rose as President Donald Trump announced a trade framework with the UK, spurring some optimism about deals to come.

title: Shell’s LNG Canada Plans First Exports as Soon as Late June
content: Shell Plc’s liquefied natural gas project in Canada, the country’s first large-scale export terminal for the fuel, is preparing to begin overseas sales as soon as late June.

title: Duffy Pitches Six New Air Traffic Control Centers After Mishaps
content: US Transportation Secretary Sean Duffy called for the construction of six new air traffic control centers and the replacement of more than 600 radars in a broad proposal to overhaul the country’s aging system that manages some 45,000 flights each day.

title: Health Crisis Deepens in Colombia as Hospitals Shut Down Units
content: The cash crunch in Colombia’s health system is forcing hospitals in the nation’s capital to close down units in order to focus efforts on other services.

title: UBS in Talks to Sell Its Hedge Fund Unit O’Connor to Cantor
content: UBS Group AG is in talks to sell its hedge fund unit O’Connor to Cantor Fitzgerald LP, a move that would end a more than three-decade run of ownership by the Swiss bank, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Bradesco Soars Most Since 2020 as Turnaround Takes Shape
content: Brazilian bank Banco Bradesco SA has finally begun to reap the results of a turnaround process that started when Chief Executive Officer Marcelo Noronha took the reins about a year and a half ago.

title: Ford Is Hanging On to High-Grade Rating by a Thread, BI Says
content: Ford Motor Co. has a “razor-thin” chance of keeping its investment-grade status at S&P Global Ratings, as tariff costs weigh on the carmaker’s profit margins, according to a report from Bloomberg Intelligence.

title: Warner Bros. Rises as Deal Speculation Overshadows Slow Quarter
content: Warner Bros. Discovery Inc., the parent of HBO and CNN, rose in New York trading on speculation it may split off its cable TV networks into a separate company, overshadowing financial results that missed estimates.

title: Bill Gates’ Charity Vows to Give Away 99% of His Fortune by 2045
content: The Gates Foundation plans to give away $200 billion over the next 20 years before shutting down entirely in 2045, marking a new deadline for one of history’s largest and most influential charities.

title: Germany’s Defense Minister Wants €50 Billion Fund, Rheinmetall CEO Says
content: German defense minister Boris Pistorius wants to earmark at least €50 billion ($56.5 billion) for special investments on top of a base annual military budget, Rheinmetall AG Chief Executive Officer Armin Papperger said.

title: Jefferies 28-Year-Old Banker Died of Toxic Drug Mix, Report Says
content: The death of a 28-year-old Jefferies Financial Group Inc. banker, which reignited discussion about Wall Street culture, was an accident caused by a toxic combination of drugs, according to a Dallas medical examiner.

title: Krispy Kreme Slumps as Dividends End, McDonald’s Plan Paused
content: Krispy Kreme Inc. shares hit a record low after saying it will no longer pay quarterly cash dividends in order to pay down its debt and focus on growth.

title: Citi’s Banamex Focused on IPO as CEO Rules Out Direct Sale of Bank
content: Citigroup Inc.’s Mexican retail bank Grupo Financiero Banamex is focused on preparing for an initial public offering as soon as the end of this year, Banamex Chief Executive Officer Manuel Romo said, dashing speculation that Citi could seek to revive plans for a direct sale of the bank.

title: Carlyle Makes Gains by Pushing Beyond Private Equity Buyouts
content: Carlyle Group Inc., which made its name on private equity deals aided by Washington connections, is reaping a greater share of profits from other businesses in time for a tough moment for markets.

title: Kohl’s Forms Committee to Find New Head After CEO’s Ouster
content: The Kohl’s Corp. board has formed a search committee to find a new top executive after its CEO Ashley Buchanan was fired last week, the retailer said in a filing.

title: Rove, founded by a 22-year-old, is helping Gen Z earn airline miles without credit cards
content: During his junior year study abroad, Max Morganroth, traveled to 30 countries, primarily flying in business and first class. His jet-setting was funded

title: Is credit card debt forgiveness smart for seniors? Here's what experts think.
content: Debt forgiveness can provide relief for some seniors, but it's important to know when it is and isn't a wise move.

title: Trump slams Newsom after California governor proposes federal film tax credit to "Make America Film Again"
content: President Trump slammed Gavin Newsom on Tuesday, just hours after the California governor asked for collaboration on a massive national film tax credit.

title: Credit Suisse to pay $511M for helping Americans evade $4B in taxes
content: Credit Suisse has pleaded guilty to criminal charges and agreed to pay $511 million for helping wealthy Americans hide more than $4 billion.

title: The AP Will Not Change Nick Ut's Credit on 'Napalm Girl' Photo
content: The AP has released an extensive report looking at whether Nick Ut is the author of the Vietnam War Napalm Girl image.

title: Royal Credit Union partnering with local non-profits for diaper drive
content: Donations will be accepted between May 1 and May 31, 2025.

title: Newsom suggests tax credit for Hollywood after Trump proposes tariffs on foreign films
content: California Gov. Gavin Newsom reached out to the Trump administration on Monday with hopes that the two can pair up and create a $7.5 billion federal film tax credit to help out the movie business.

title: How holding rates steady affects you
content: From credit cards and mortgage rates to auto loans and savings accounts, all sorts of consumer borrowing costs are impacted by Fed moves.

title: Credit Suisse fined for helping rich Americans hide over $4 billion from the taxman
content: A Credit Suisse unit has pleaded guilty to US charges of helping ultra-wealthy Americans evade taxes and will pay a fine of more than $510 million.

title: Trump overhypes $5 trillion in private US investments pledges
content: Presidents often claim credit for the good things that happen while they’re in office. But Trump is taking things to a new level.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Seed Funding Rose In These Spaces
content: Even as overall seed-stage investment declined in 2024, a few areas saw big gains. This includes the obvious category — AI — as well as a subset of sectors largely focused on automating things that humans currently do. We take a look at four top picks.

title: Recruiter Woes Compound as Tariffs Sting Global Labor Markets
content: Recruiters across Europe and the US had a dismal start to the year. US President Donald Trump’s tariffs are now dimming their prospects for the rest of 2025.

title: EU Goes on Offense to Retain Firms and Counter Trump’s Tariffs
content: The European Union is planning to counter President Donald Trump’s efforts to lure companies to the US by easing the bloc’s regulatory burden on sectors from autos to chemicals to aeronautics.

title: Nigeria Overhauls Colonial-Era Tax Rules in Pro-Business Push
content: Halfway into a four-year tenure, President Bola Tinubu’s push to reform the floundering economy of Africa’s most-populous country has received the most significant thrust yet: An overhaul of tax laws, some that date back to Nigeria’s colonial past.

title: China’s Consumer Deflation Extends as Tariffs Take Toll
content: China’s consumer deflation extended for a third month in April as punitive tariffs imposed by the US add to a drag on prices from weak domestic demand.

title: CATL Seeks at Least $4 Billion for Hong Kong Listing
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is planning to seek at least $4 billion from its Hong Kong stock offering, people familiar with the matter said, which would make it the world’s biggest listing this year.

title: ECB Needs Steady Hand and Mustn’t Overdo Rate Cuts, Schnabel Says
content: The European Central Bank needs a “steady hand” and mustn’t lower borrowing costs too much as inflation could turn out to be higher in the future, Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel said.

title: S&P 500 Wavers After $6 Trillion Run on Trade Risk: Markets Wrap
content: Wall Street ended the week on a more cautious note, with stocks and bonds fluctuating as the world’s two largest economies get ready to kickstart their trade negotiations.

title: Global Funds Chase Asian Stocks as FX Surge Counters Trade Angst
content: Global funds are piling back into Asian stocks as the attraction of soaring currencies and resilient earnings offsets concern that higher US tariffs will sap the region’s economic growth.

title: Flock of Fed Speakers Show No Eagerness to Consider Rate Cuts
content: On a day when more than half of the Federal Reserve’s policymakers offered public remarks, not one made it sound like the US central bank was near lowering interest rates.

title: The Fed Decision, IRS Cutbacks, Ireland’s Corporate Tax | Wall Street Week
content: This week, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Economist Kenneth Rogoff weigh the effects of President Trump's monetary policy. And, how will the IRS carry out its mandate under the Trump administration’s recent staff and funding cuts? Plus, across the pond, how will tariffs affect Ireland’s corporate tax policies that have attracted American companies to its shores? Later, academic leaders talk about colleges' handling of antisemitism and President Trump’s decision to cut federal funding for research. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: UrbanStems expected to ship 4 million stems on this coming Mother’s Day. In an interview on "The Close" UrbanStems CEO Meenakshi Lala discusses the growth of the business, impact of tariffs, and how fast the company can support last minute orders. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: Jamaica Stock Exchange Managing Director Marlene Street Forrest discusses the transformation of Jamaica’s stock exchange and says technology, including AI, will help continue the growth of the exchange. She speaks with Romaine Bostick and Scarlet Fu on “The Close.” (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ponzi-Like Fraud Gets GPB Founder Gentile Seven Years in Prison
content: GPB Capital Holdings LLC founder David Gentile was sentenced to seven years in prison for a Ponzi-like fraud scheme that put almost $1.6 billion of investor funds at risk.

content: Comprehensive cross-platform coverage of the U.S. market close on Bloomberg Television, Bloomberg Radio, and YouTube with Romaine Bostick, Alix Steel, Scarlet Fu, Matt Miller and Norah Mulinda. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Vows to Meet Hollywood on Tariff Plan That Shook Industry
content:
President Donald Trump said he would meet with Hollywood executives after confounding the US film industry over his plan to impose a 100% tariff on movies made overseas. 
“So we’re going to meet with the industry,” Trump said Monday afternoon. “I want to make sure they’re happy with it, because we’re all about jobs.”
Film and entertainment figures on Monday struggled to interpret Trump’s directive, posted to his social media account on Sunday evening, which said the American movie industry is “DYING” and cast foreign films as a national security threat that spread propaganda to US audiences.
“WE WANT MOVIES MADE IN AMERICA, AGAIN!” Trump said.
Shares of Netflix Inc., Paramount Global, Warner Bros. Discovery Inc. and other media and entertainment companies slid as Wall Street and Hollywood tried to discern what aspect of filmmaking would qualify for such tariffs and why it should be targeted like other industries. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Trump Says 10% Tariff Baseline Unless ‘Exceptional’ Offer Made
content: President Donald Trump said that he would “always” impose a minimum 10% tariff on trading partners — before quickly adding that “there could be an exception,” underscoring the difficulty discerning the US approach to dozens of trade deals under negotiation.

content: Omada Health Inc. filed for an initial public offering that could capitalize on the digital health care startup’s growing revenue and shrinking losses.

title: Bessent Says Debt Limit Measures Could Run Out in August
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told US lawmakers that his department’s ability to use special accounting maneuvers to stay within the federal debt limit could be exhausted in August.

title: Retail Investors Have Been Buying the Dip Through Tariff Volatility

title: Mexico Finance Chief Says USMCA-Protected Exports Bolster Growth
content: Mexico’s finance chief Edgar Amador said the North American free trade agreement should continue to bolster the economy despite the threat that the US could push for major changes to it.

title: US Officials Weigh Broad Pullback in Newark Airport Flights
content: Airlines and US aviation officials plan to meet to discuss further flight cutbacks at Newark airport following multiple breakdowns in radar systems, according to people familiar with the matter. Ryan Beene reports on Bloomberg Television.

title: Peru’s Emergency Mining Ban to Cost $200 Million in Lost Gold Output
content: Peruvian gold output is expected to be significantly dented in the coming month due to a mining ban in a northern region of the country that’s seen an up-tick in criminal activity culminating in the murder of 13 mine workers.

title: 10-Year To End Year Around 4-4.25%: UBS's Falconio
content: Head of Taxable Fixed Income Strategy at UBS Global Wealth Management Leslie Falconio, calls for the 10-year to end around 4-4.25%. In an interview with Sonali Basak on "Real Yield" she says bonds can be a diversifier, "just need to pick your spots." (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Alphabet Shares Take $138 Billion Blow as Search Warnings Blare
content: For more than a year, Alphabet Inc. shareholders have fretted over long-term risks posed by artificial intelligence to the company’s money-printing search business. This week the threat became much more immediate.

title: JPMorgan Caught Out by EM Currency Gains: It ‘Has Not Worked’
content: On the day President Donald Trump unveiled the steepest tariff hikes for US trading partners in a century, JPMorgan Chase & Co. had a trade idea for clients: Go bearish on emerging-market currencies.

title: Indians Hoard Food, Cancel Trips Amid Escalating Armed Conflict
content: Many Indians, especially those living in areas closer to the Pakistan border, have started hoarding essentials and canceling travel plans amid a rapid escalation in military conflict between the two nuclear-armed nations.

title: US-China Open Trade Talks in Bid to Wind Down Their Tariff War
content: High-stakes talks between the world’s two largest economies are opening in Switzerland on Saturday, offering the clearest opportunity yet for the US and China to de-escalate their trade war.

title: India, Pakistan Move Closer to Full War After Bases Targeted
content: Pakistan and India moved closer to all-out war as each said they struck the other’s military sites in the early hours of Saturday.

title: EU Goes on Offense to Retain Firms and Counter Trump’s Tariffs
content: The European Union is planning to counter President Donald Trump’s efforts to lure companies to the US by easing the bloc’s regulatory burden on sectors from autos to chemicals to aeronautics.

title: Europe in Talks With US Over Ultimatum to End War in Ukraine
content: Senior European officials are in talks with the Trump administration to finalize an agreement on a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine that would impose new sanctions on Russia if President Vladimir Putin doesn’t budge, said people familiar with the matter.

title: Keir Starmer’s Trump Win Fails to Calm Labour Party’s Worries About Farage
content: Keir Starmer’s double victory in securing trade deals with India and the US this week still isn’t enough to pacify restive lawmakers in the UK’s governing Labour Party.

title: Columbia Launches Research Stabilization Funds After Trump Cuts
content: Columbia University has launched two research stabilization funds after US President Donald Trump pulled $400 million from its funding, according to a post on its website written by the school’s Acting President Claire Shipman.

title: Malaysia’s Rafizi to Face Anwar’s Daughter in Party Polls
content: Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli will compete against Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s daughter for their party’s deputy presidency, a development that’s set to heighten tensions in the country’s ruling bloc.

title: House Tax Panel Releases Partial Version of Trump Bill
content: The House Ways and Means Committee on Friday night released a partial version of President Donald Trump’s tax proposal that calls for increasing the maximum child tax credit to $2,500 and raising the estate tax exemption to $15 million.

title: Newark Mayor Baraka Freed After Arrest at ICE Detention Center
content: Ras Baraka, the mayor of Newark, New Jersey, was released from custody Friday night following his arrest while protesting at a private detention facility that is expected to play a key role in President Donald Trump’s plans for mass deportations.

title: Trump Says 80% China Tariff ‘Seems Right,’ Ahead of Talks
content: President Donald Trump floated an 80% tariff on China ahead of negotiations due to begin Saturday as he urged Beijing to do more to open their markets to US goods.

title: Marcos Touts Philippine Economic Gains in Last Senate Vote Pitch
content: Philippine President Ferdinand Marcos Jr. touted economic gains under his government as he made a final pitch for his Senate candidates before the May 12 midterm vote.

title: India, Pakistan Trade Accusations as Border Tensions Simmer
content: India and Pakistan continued to trade accusations about military action against each other as hostilities entered a third day with no signs of easing.

title: Trump Opens Door to Tariffs on Commercial Aircraft, Engines
content: The Trump administration is probing whether imported aircraft, jet engines and parts represent a threat to national security, a precursor to imposing new tariffs targeting the commercial aerospace industry.

title: US Official Meets With Mexico Bankers on Cartel Financing Risks
content: A US Treasury Department official made an unannounced visit to Mexico’s annual banking convention to discuss stepping up efforts to combat organized-crime finances.

title: Trump Says NYC’s Adams Came to White House to ‘Thank Me’
content: New York City Mayor Eric Adams said he was visiting the White House to discuss important matters impacting his constituents, but President Donald Trump after their meeting said the two discussed “almost nothing.”

title: Trump to Tap McKernan for Domestic Finance Role at Treasury
content: President Donald Trump intends to nominate attorney Jonathan McKernan as the Treasury Department’s head of domestic finance, a surprise move given he was previously tapped to run the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau.

title: Trump Says 10% Tariff Baseline Unless ‘Exceptional’ Offer Made
content: President Donald Trump said that he would “always” impose a minimum 10% tariff on trading partners — before quickly adding that “there could be an exception,” underscoring the difficulty discerning the US approach to dozens of trade deals under negotiation.

title: US Hit 1,000 Houthi Targets Under Trump, Pentagon Says
content: US forces have struck more than 1,000 targets in President Donald Trump’s campaign against Houthi militants in Yemen, the Pentagon said, offering rare insight into a stepped-up offensive that’s been conducted largely in secret.

title: Staten Island’s Malliotakis Open to $30,000 SALT Cap
content: Representative Nicole Malliotakis said increasing the state and local tax deduction cap to $30,000 from $10,000 would reduce the tax burden of the vast majority of people in her district, indicating support for a proposal that is dividing Republicans.

title: Trump Heading to Middle East Seeking Investments in US
content: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. title: Mexico Finance Chief Says USMCA-Protected Exports Bolster Growth
content: Mexico’s finance chief Edgar Amador said the North American free trade agreement should continue to bolster the economy despite the threat that the US could push for major changes to it.

content: Trump administration officials are crafting executive orders to expedite the approval and construction of nuclear power plants across the US, a bid to meet surging electricity demand.

title: Trump’s Deportation Campaign Fuels Prison Founder’s $304 Million Fortune
content: Not far from Ellis Island, “Golden Door” for 12 million immigrants, things are looking up for a growth opportunity in today’s America: deportation.

title: IMF Approves $1 Billion Pakistan Payment Over India Protest
content: The International Monetary Fund’s executive board on Friday approved a roughly $1 billion loan disbursements to Pakistan, bringing some relief for the nation’s fragile finances amid its worsening conflict with neighboring India.

title: Trump Weighs Suspending Migrants’ Ability to Challenge Detention
content: The White House is “actively looking at” whether to suspend the ability of migrants to challenge their detention in court as part of an effort to speed its deportation efforts, senior adviser Stephen Miller said Friday.

title: Tufts Grad Student Öztürk Is Freed on Bail in Trump Setback
content: A federal judge freed a Turkish graduate student on bail while she fights possible deportation over the Trump administration’s claims of antisemitism in an op-ed she helped write.

title: Ukraine Detains Alleged Hungarian Spies in New Blow to Ties
content: Ukraine and Hungary expelled diplomats in a tit-for-tat move that followed the detention of two people who authorities in Kyiv said had been spying for its European Union neighbor.

title: Ex-Palantir Adviser to Keep SpaceX, OpenAI Stakes in Trump Role
content: Former Palantir Technologies Inc. adviser Jacob Helberg plans to retain investments in dozens of artificial intelligence, defense and fintech companies as he starts his tenure as an under secretary of state in Donald Trump’s administration.

title: Trump Plans Trio of Executive Actions Targeting Regulations
content: President Donald Trump is expected to sign a trio of new executive actions on Friday designed to reduce the impact of regulations, part of an effort the White House has said will inspire economic growth.

content: Representative Jake Auchincloss bats aside President Donald Trump's latest gambit regarding a tax increase on wealthy earners, saying the president changes his views quickly. He spoke with Kailey Leinz on the late edition of Bloomberg's ``Balance of Power'' after Trump tempered his initial support for the hike. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: LaHood Discusses China Trade Policy, Debt Limit
content: Rep. Darin LaHood, (R) Illinois, talks about trade policy between the United States and China, saying that China cannot continue to manipulate trade policy. He also talks about debt limit and says he is confident Congress will reach a vote by mid-July. Rep. LaHood speaks with Kailey Leinz on Bloomberg's "Balance of Power." (Source: Bloomberg)
