title: Alphabet Shares Take $138 Billion Blow as Search Warnings Blare
content: For more than a year, Alphabet Inc. shareholders have fretted over long-term risks posed by artificial intelligence to the company’s money-printing search business. This week the threat became much more immediate.

title: Bain Capital Is Talks to Buy PCI Pharma at a $10 Billion Valuation
content: Bain Capital is in talks to buy PCI Pharma Services, people with knowledge of the matter said, in a deal that would rank among the year’s largest private equity takeovers.

title: Apple Eyes AI Server Chips, Lyft CEO Talks Growth Plans | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the possible impact of trade talks between the US and China. Plus, Lyft CEO David Risher talks about the markets where the company is investing. And, DraftKings CEO, Jason Robins, explains the impact of a surprising March Madness. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ex-Palantir Adviser to Keep SpaceX, OpenAI Stakes in Trump Role
content: Former Palantir Technologies Inc. adviser Jacob Helberg plans to retain investments in dozens of artificial intelligence, defense and fintech companies as he starts his tenure as an under secretary of state in Donald Trump’s administration.

title: Sonos Interim CEO Says Company Has Turned a Corner and He Wants the Top Job
content: Sonos Inc. interim Chief Executive Officer Tom Conrad said the audio company has “turned the corner” following setbacks caused by software issues — and that he wants to be named to the top job permanently.

title: Zscaler's Chaudhry Stays Bullish Despite Tariffs, DOGE Fallout
content: ‘I’m an optimist. I think it’s going to all settle down.’

title: How the Google Antitrust Trial Is Already Changing Online Search
content: A decade ago, when Microsoft Corp. was reined in by the Justice Department, a prominent Silicon Valley attorney popularized a theory about antitrust cases: “The trial is the remedy.”

title: OpenAI’s Simo Tasked With Keeping ChatGPT Ahead of Bot Rivals
content: Simo will oversee executives and seek to broaden the company's hit chatbot into a Swiss Army knife of artificial intelligence software.

title: Whoop Faces Backlash After Charging Existing Users Upgrade Fee for New Models
content: Whoop Inc., the maker of popular screen-less fitness bands, is facing a backlash from subscribers upset that it’s charging an upgrade fee for the new models after previously pledging not to do so.

title: ‘Grand Theft Auto VI’ Delay Impacts Every Game Company
content: When Rockstar pushed back the release of the highly anticipated title, some game makers breathed a sigh of relief. Others are holding emergency meetings.

title: CoreWeave in Talks for $1.5 Billion Debt Deal 6 Weeks After IPO
content: Less than two months after a heavily scaled down initial public offering, CoreWeave Inc. is in discussions to raise about $1.5 billion in debt, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Ether Surges 30% in Best Week Since 2021 as Trade Tensions Ease
content: Ether led a broad cryptocurrency rally this week, heading for its strongest gains since 2021, bolstered by easing global trade tensions and optimism over a network upgrade.

title: US Probes Role of CrowdStrike Bosses in Carahsoft Deal
content: US prosecutors and regulators investigating a $32 million deal between CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. and a technology distributor are probing what senior company executives may have known about it and are examining other transactions made by the cybersecurity firm, according to two people familiar with the matter.

title: The Elite Microsoft Unit Constantly Working to Thwart Hackers
content: Over the past decade, the software company has become a pillar of US cyber defenses — a position that could become more complicated under Trump.

title: 'Genshin Impact' Creator Dives Into AI for Growth Beyond Games
content: HoYoverse plots a future path to reach further than its anime roots

title: Panasonic to Slash 10,000 Jobs in Shift to Data, Energy Storage
content: Panasonic Holdings Corp. is slashing headcount by 10,000, or more than 4%, part of a push to cull non-growth operations and boost profitability.

title: Apple Device Management Pioneer Jamf to Expand to Android
content: Jamf Holding Corp., best known for helping businesses manage and secure Apple Inc. devices, will begin offering mobile management services for Android users.

title: Citigroup Seeks Namibia, Benin Business as Investment Jumps
content: Citigroup Inc. is in talks with African governments including Namibia and Benin to boost business as investment flows into the countries.

title: Spain Blackout Shows Need for Batteries in Renewable-Heavy World
content: Companies are working on technologies from batteries to AI that can help ensure renewables and more electricity demand don’t threaten the grid.

title: Europe’s Gig Economy Is Consolidating Under US Ownership
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Natalie Lung looks at how US gig economy companies are leveraging domestic success into an aggressive strategy to go global.

title: Tech Industry Warns US Investment Pledges Hinge on Research Tax Break
content: Major tech companies lobbying to salvage a tax deduction for research and development are warning they may pull back from high-profile pledges of new US investments if Congress doesn’t fully reinstate the break.

title: China’s Top Chipmaker SMIC Warns Production Issues Hit Sales
content: Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. plunged Friday after China’s leading chipmaker warned sales could fall as much as 6% this quarter because of production disruptions.

title: Nintendo Doesn’t Rule Out Switch Price Hike After Soft Outlook
content: Nintendo Co. warned it may yet increase the cost of its long-anticipated new console, after projecting weaker-than-expected initial sales of the Switch 2.

title: DeepSeek Punctured the Myth That Silicon Valley Could Control AI
content: In just two years, China’s open-source artificial intelligence movement allowed it to virtually close the gap with its US peers.

title: Swissquote Seeks to Shake Crypto Link Despite 1,500% Stock Rally
content: When Swissquote Group Holding SA became the first European bank to let clients trade Bitcoin in 2017, the cryptocurrency was changing hands for around $2,000 per token.

title: German Cops Seize €34 Million of Crypto Assets in ‘eXch’ Swoop
content: German authorities closed down the crypto-swapping service “eXch” located in the nation and seized assets worth €34 million ($38 million).

title: Sunil Mittal Is Said Poised to Buy $2 Billion Stake in Haier India
content: Sunil Mittal is in advanced talks to acquire a 49% stake in the Indian unit of China’s Haier Smart Home Co., according to people familiar with the matter, as the billionaire looks to tap growing demand for goods such as home appliances in the South Asian country.

title: Ex-Northvolt CEO Gets New Funds for AI Startup in Manufacturing
content: Two former executives from bankrupt battery maker Northvolt AB have launched a new venture in Sweden that will utilize artificial intelligence to help manufacturing processes.

title: TSMC April Sales Surge After US Tariffs Spur Device Rush Orders
content: Taiwan Semiconductor Manufacturing Co.’s revenue jumped 48% in April, underscoring how electronics firms scrambled to acquire essential components before global tariffs took effect.

title: NTT Announces 200 Billion Yen Buyback in Capital Efficiency Push
content: Nippon Telegraph and Telephone Corp. said it plans to buy back as much as ¥200 billion ($1.4 billion) of its shares, joining a growing string of such measures bolstering the Japanese market.

title: Recruiter Woes Compound as Tariffs Sting Global Labor Markets
content: Recruiters across Europe and the US had a dismal start to the year. US President Donald Trump’s tariffs are now dimming their prospects for the rest of 2025.

title: US-China Open Trade Talks in Bid to Wind Down Their Tariff War
content: High-stakes talks between the world’s two largest economies are opening in Switzerland on Saturday, offering the clearest opportunity yet for the US and China to de-escalate their trade war.

title: Egyptian Inflation Little Changed With More Rate Cuts on Horizon
content: Egyptian inflation slightly accelerated for a second month, an anticipated quickening driven by a cut in fuel subsidies that’s unlikely to put the brakes on a long-awaited monetary-easing cycle.

title: EU Goes on Offense to Retain Firms and Counter Trump’s Tariffs
content: The European Union is planning to counter President Donald Trump’s efforts to lure companies to the US by easing the bloc’s regulatory burden on sectors from autos to chemicals to aeronautics.

title: Nigeria Overhauls Colonial-Era Tax Rules in Pro-Business Push
content: Halfway into a four-year tenure, President Bola Tinubu’s push to reform the floundering economy of Africa’s most-populous country has received the most significant thrust yet: An overhaul of tax laws, some that date back to Nigeria’s colonial past.

title: Eurovision Fans Find Swiss Franc’s Latest Surge Hits a Sour Note
content: As many as half a million fans heading to Basel for the Eurovision Song Contest next week are about to discover that Swiss prices stoked by the franc’s gains are far from music to their ears.

title: China’s Consumer Deflation Extends as Tariffs Take Toll
content: China’s consumer deflation extended for a third month in April as punitive tariffs imposed by the US add to a drag on prices from weak domestic demand.

title: ECB Needs Steady Hand and Mustn’t Overdo Rate Cuts, Schnabel Says
content: The European Central Bank needs a “steady hand” and mustn’t lower borrowing costs too much as inflation could turn out to be higher in the future, Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel said.

title: Trump Says 80% China Tariff ‘Seems Right,’ Ahead of Talks
content: President Donald Trump floated an 80% tariff on China ahead of negotiations due to begin Saturday as he urged Beijing to do more to open their markets to US goods.

title: Flock of Fed Speakers Show No Eagerness to Consider Rate Cuts
content: On a day when more than half of the Federal Reserve’s policymakers offered public remarks, not one made it sound like the US central bank was near lowering interest rates.

title: Argentina Halts Private Bond Sale Amid Pressure on Peso Rate
content: Argentina’s central bank intervened to stop a dollar bond sale by Banco Supervielle halfway through the trading day on Friday, according to two people with knowledge of the matter, a move that could avert pressure on the peso in the parallel exchange market.

title: US Official Meets With Mexico Bankers on Cartel Financing Risks
content: A US Treasury Department official made an unannounced visit to Mexico’s annual banking convention to discuss stepping up efforts to combat organized-crime finances.

title: Fed Governor Michelle Bowman Hires Staffers From Goldman, Davis Polk and BPI
content: US Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman, who’s on track to become vice chair for supervision, has turned to the banking world for three staff picks, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Says 10% Tariff Baseline Unless ‘Exceptional’ Offer Made
content: President Donald Trump said that he would “always” impose a minimum 10% tariff on trading partners — before quickly adding that “there could be an exception,” underscoring the difficulty discerning the US approach to dozens of trade deals under negotiation.

title: Bessent Says Debt Limit Measures Could Run Out in August
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told US lawmakers that his department’s ability to use special accounting maneuvers to stay within the federal debt limit could be exhausted in August.

title: Seattle Businesses Take Canadian Cash at Par to Lure Sports Fans
content: For years, the arrival of the Toronto Blue Jays in Seattle brought a familiar sight: tens of thousands of exuberant Canadians pouring into the city to cheer on their baseball team.

title: Mexico Finance Chief Says USMCA-Protected Exports Bolster Growth
content: Mexico’s finance chief Edgar Amador said the North American free trade agreement should continue to bolster the economy despite the threat that the US could push for major changes to it.

title: IMF Approves $1 Billion Pakistan Payment Over India Protest
content: The International Monetary Fund’s executive board on Friday approved a roughly $1 billion loan disbursements to Pakistan, bringing some relief for the nation’s fragile finances amid its worsening conflict with neighboring India.

title: US Stocks End Week Lower as Investors Look Ahead to China Talks
content: US stocks closed little changed Friday to notch a small weekly loss as traders weighed comments from President Donald Trump suggesting that an 80% tariff on China seemed right, just as negotiations between the two countries are set to begin on Saturday.

title: Ghana’s Credit Rating Raised by S&P After Spending Cut Plans
content: Ghana’s credit rating was raised by S&P Global Ratings after the new administration unveiled plans to rein in spending as the West African nation recovers from a painful debt restructuring.

title: Ghana’s Debt Burden Seen Falling Sharply on Economic Expansion
content: Ghana’s debt burden will ease sharply this year as the economy expands and the government reins in spending after a debt crisis, Barclays Plc said.

title: Warsh Suggests Fed’s Tariff Remarks Imply Impaired Credibility
content: Kevin Warsh, who is seen as a possible contender to be the next Federal Reserve chair, suggested the US central bank would be at fault if it cannot prevent tariff-related price hikes from leading to a persistent rise in inflation.

title: Trump’s Priority List for Tariff Talks Homes In on Around 20 Economies
content: The Trump administration’s first trade talks involve an eclectic mix of major exporters and smaller economies, as the White House looks to rack up agreements that could serve as models for other negotiations.

title: What to Know About the US-China Trade War as Talks Begin
content: The future of one of the world’s biggest trading relationships hangs in the balance after US President Donald Trump escalated the tariff war with China by imposing steep duties on imports from the country.

title: Options Traders Flock to Wager That Fed Won’t Cut Interest Rates
content: A contrarian wager that the Federal Reserve won’t cut interest rates this year is exploding in the options market.

title: Weak Jobs Report Raises Odds of Bank of Canada Cut in June
content: Canadian jobs data point to the start of a period of rising unemployment, and markets are betting the Bank of Canada is more likely to restart interest rate cuts in June.

title: Five Factors to Think About When It Comes to Tariffs and Inflation
content: Hello and welcome to the newsletter, a grab bag of daily content from the Odd Lots universe. Sometimes it's us, Joe Weisenthal and Tracy Alloway, bringing you our thoughts on the most recent developments in markets, finance and the economy. And sometimes it's contributions from our network of expert guests and sources. Whatever it is, we promise it will always be interesting.

title: Waller Signals Firing Fed Officials Would Be Bad for US Economy
content: Federal Reserve Governor Christopher Waller said economic stability is improved when monetary policymakers are both accountable to voters and have job security.

title: Swiss Want a ‘Level Playing Field’ in Trade Deal With US
content: Switzerland held what it said were “constructive” trade talks with US officials Friday while indicating that negotiations can’t be all about concessions to Donald Trump’s administration.

title: US Farm Economy Is Starting to See First Hits From Trump Tariffs
content: Donald Trump’s tariffs are upending crop trading, delaying tractor purchases and constraining imports of chemical supplies into the US.

title: Officials, Airlines to Talk Newark Reductions After Outages
content: Airlines and aviation officials plan to meet on May 14 to discuss further flight cutbacks at Newark airport following multiple breakdowns in radar systems.

title: Newark Airport Hit by Another 90-Second Radar Outage
content: Air traffic controllers guiding planes in and out of Newark Liberty International Airport briefly lost communications and radar displays early Friday morning, the second outage in as many weeks affecting the transportation hub.

title: Trump Opens Door to Tariffs on Commercial Aircraft, Engines
content: The Trump administration is probing whether imported aircraft, jet engines and parts represent a threat to national security, a precursor to imposing new tariffs targeting the commercial aerospace industry.

title: US Official Meets With Mexico Bankers on Cartel Financing Risks
content: A US Treasury Department official made an unannounced visit to Mexico’s annual banking convention to discuss stepping up efforts to combat organized-crime finances.

title: Kohl’s Board Fight Spills Out After Director Departure
content: Kohl’s Corp. said on Friday the recent departure of a board director was related to a disagreement with the company — an abrupt change in stance from a day earlier and the latest sign of turmoil at the beleaguered retailer.

title: Hedge Funds Soured on Oil as OPEC Agreed to Bumper Supply Hike
content: Hedge funds turned the least bullish on Brent crude in about six months as OPEC+ agreed to a second major production increase, inflaming concerns that the extra supply could lead to a global glut.

title: Tufts Grad Student Öztürk Is Freed on Bail in Trump Setback
content: A federal judge freed a Turkish graduate student on bail while she fights possible deportation over the Trump administration’s claims of antisemitism in an op-ed she helped write.

title: Sarepta’s Week Goes From Bad to Worse on FDA Fears, Outlook Cut
content: Sarepta Therapeutics Inc. capped its worst week in four years as disappointing earnings and regulatory fears hit the drugmaker’s shares.

title: Oil Rises as Focus Shifts to US-China Trade Talks After UK Deal
content: Oil rose as algorithmic traders fled short positions amid renewed optimism about trade talks between the US and China this weekend.

title: Nestle to Raise Prices of Some US Chocolate on High Cocoa Costs
content: Nestle USA is increasing prices for some chocolate products due to commodity costs, a sign that sweet treats will stay expensive for consumers in the near term.

title: US Measles Cases Surpass 1,000 as Texas Infection Rate Slows
content: The US has confirmed 1,001 measles cases since the outbreak began in January, even as the virus’ spread in the hardest-hit state has slowed.

title: Stellantis Nears CEO Decision With US Boss a Top Contender
content: Stellantis NV is approaching the end of its complicated search for a new chief executive officer, with Americas boss Antonio Filosa emerging as the leading candidate, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: CoreWeave in Talks for $1.5 Billion Debt Deal 6 Weeks After IPO
content: Less than two months after a heavily scaled down initial public offering, CoreWeave Inc. is in discussions to raise about $1.5 billion in debt, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: San Francisco Train System Shut for Hours After Computer Issue
content: The San Francisco Bay area’s largest train system shut down for about four hours Friday after a computer problem, leaving thousands of workers across the region without access to a critical commuting option.

title: Santander Rejected Bid of About £11 Billion for UK Unit, FT Says
content: Banco Santander SA rejected a bid worth between £10 billion ($13 billion) and £12 billion for its UK retail bank from NatWest Group Plc earlier this year, according to the Financial Times.

title: Costco Makes Deal With Affirm Giving Shoppers Payment Plans
content: Costco Wholesale Corp. is tapping Affirm Holdings Inc. to let the retailer’s online shoppers pay over time for a transaction, an option that’s been helping many merchants sell bigger-ticket items and gives consumers more comfort in buying them.

title: Bankrupt Federal Contractor Seeks Fast Sale to Avoid DOGE Threat
content: A federal contractor that filed bankruptcy earlier this week during the latest round of government cutbacks asked a judge to approve a quick auction because of the ongoing threat of Elon Musk’s Department of Government Efficiency.

title: Post Office Names FedEx Director Steiner Postmaster General
content: The United States Postal Service has selected FedEx Corp. board member David Steiner to be the country’s next postmaster general, the agency announced on Friday.

title: Zepbound Patients Fear Losing Coverage After CVS Deal for Wegovy
content: Allison Stange lost 40 pounds since starting Zepbound in April 2024, improving both her blood pressure and sleep apnea. Now she fears a deal struck between CVS Health Corp. and Novo Nordisk A/S will undo all that progress.

title: Germany’s New Finance Minister Backs Commerzbank Independence
content: Germany backs Commerzbank AG as an independent firm, Finance Minister Lars Klingbeil said Friday, indicating that opposition to the bank’s potential takeover by UniCredit SpA won’t abate under the country’s new government.

title: JPMorgan to Rent 20 Floors in Historic Buenos Aires Office Deal
content: JPMorgan Chase & Co. is expanding its footprint in Argentina with new office space, marking one of largest corporate rental properties over the past two decades in the nation’s capital.

title: Boston Celtics Investors to Decide Whether to Stay or Go
content: The Celtics and their investors have some big decisions to make now that they’re down 0-2 to the Knicks.

title: Fiera Tumbles on 50% Dividend Cut as CEO Desjardins Steps Down
content: Shares of Fiera Capital Corp. plunged by as much as 10.4% after the company chopped its dividend in half, as founder Jean-Guy Desjardins steps aside as chief executive officer to make way for Maxime Menard.

title: German Investor Deka In Exclusive Talks to Buy Dublin Office Block
content: German investor Deka Immobilien is in exclusive talks to buy a prime Dublin office building, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Air Canada Lowers 2025 Outlook as Travel to US Declines
content: Shares of Air Canada soared by as much as 13% Friday morning as the airline reported a lower — but better than expected — profit forecast for 2025 as President Donald Trump’s trade war slows the economy and discourages some Canadians from traveling to the US.

title: Traders’ Guide to US Stocks Most Affected in China Trade Talks
content: US equity investors will be watching closely as trade talks kick off between the Trump administration and China, with trillions of dollars hanging in the balance for American companies.

title: Sweetgreen Says Tariffs Led to Sharp Decline in Dining Out
content: Sweetgreen Inc. cut its annual guidance, citing a sharp decline in consumer sentiment following the announcement of new tariffs in the US.

title: Italy’s Banks Display Earnings Strength Amid Deal Wave
content: A group of banks involved in a series of deals reshaping Italy’s finance industry posted profits that beat estimates, highlighting the industry’s strength.

content: President Donald Trump is betting that tariffs on imports of vehicles and automotive parts will bring more manufacturing to US shores.

content: President Trump slammed Gavin Newsom on Tuesday, just hours after the California governor asked for collaboration on a massive national film tax credit.

content: Credit Suisse has pleaded guilty to criminal charges and agreed to pay $511 million for helping wealthy Americans hide more than $4 billion.

content: From credit cards and mortgage rates to auto loans and savings accounts, all sorts of consumer borrowing costs are impacted by Fed moves.

content: A Credit Suisse unit has pleaded guilty to US charges of helping ultra-wealthy Americans evade taxes and will pay a fine of more than $510 million.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Aramco Profit Drops With Weak Oil Signaling More Strain
content: Saudi Aramco reported a decline in profit in the first quarter as lower crude prices put pressure on the finances of the world’s biggest oil exporter.

title: Stock Bulls in India, Pakistan Anticipate Rebound After Truce
content: Stocks in India and Pakistan are set for a relief rally following a surprise ceasefire agreement between the two nuclear-armed neighbors on Saturday, as investor focus shifts back to improving economic outlook.

title: Saudi Hospital Operator SMC to Raise Up To $500 Million in IPO
content: Saudi Arabian hospital operator Specialized Medical Co. is seeking to raise as much as $500 million in an initial public offering in Riyadh, as listings across the Persian Gulf regain momentum despite volatile markets.

title: US Inflation Starting to Stir as Trump Tariff Threat Looms
content: US consumer prices probably picked up in April after the smallest advance in nine months, foreshadowing a broader acceleration as many companies seek to pass on higher tariffs.

title: Phillips 66 Loses Glass Lewis Support for Three Directors
content: Proxy advisory firm Glass Lewis said shareholders of Phillips 66 should vote for three board nominees put forward by Elliott Investment Management, amid a proxy battle between the US oil refiner and activist investor.

title: Wall Street Plays Long Game as Deals Go Private
content: A KKR & Co. debt sale shows how far Wall Street is willing to go to keep leveraged underwriting business from slipping away to private credit after periods of turmoil.

title: ECB’s Vujcic Expects Inflation to Slow to 2% Target by Year-End
content: Consumer-price growth will hit the European Central Bank’s 2% target by the end of 2025, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic.

title: Brazilian Court Lifts Block on BRB Acquisition of Banco Master
content: A Brazilian judge revoked a court decision that blocked the planned sale of Banco Master SA to BRB SA because of an alleged failure by the banks to comply with legal requirements for an acquisition.

title: Karachi Residents React to India, Pakistan Ceasefire
content: Karachi residents react to India, Pakistan Ceasefire on May 10th. The deal follows weeks of clashes, missile and drone strikes across their borders that were triggered by a gun massacre of tourists last month. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Canadian Telecom Firms Blame Immigration Policies for Mobile Subscriber Slowdown
content: For years, Canada’s top telecom providers rode a wave of high immigration, collectively adding hundreds of thousands of new mobile phone subscribers most quarters. Those days are over.

title: IRS Cutbacks: US Revenue at Risk
content: As President Trump has made cutting government bloat a priority for his second term in office, the IRS has been one of the hardest hit agencies. How will personnel and funding cuts affect the IRS? Former IRS Commissioner Chuck Rettig and Yale's Natasha Sarin weigh in on the history of the IRS and the revenue that the United States stands to lose by cutting the IRS. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: The Fed’s 'Watchful Waiting' on Economic Uncertainty
content: How does the Fed balance higher unemployment with higher inflation? Former Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Economist Kenneth Rogoff comment on the Fed’s decision to hold interest rates steady as President Trump calls for rate cuts. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: In Monetary Policy and in Trade, It’s All ‘a Matter of Arithmetic’
content: Welcome to the Wall Street Week newsletter, bringing you stories of capitalism about things you need to know, but even more things you need to think about. I’m David Westin, and this week former Treasury Secretary Larry Summers brought us the story of the Federal Reserve acting in the face of uncertainty, and former Irish Prime Minister Leo Varadkar explained how his country attracted all those US pharmaceutical companies. If you’re not yet a subscriber, sign up here for this newsletter.

title: For Exhausted Stock Market Pros the Choice Is Buy or Stay Home
content: The stock market’s stunning rebound over the last month has largely been driven by Main Street investors buying the dip in everything in sight while professional money managers ditched US stocks, spooked by mounting fears of slowing economic growth and trade war disruptions.

content: Man Group Plc is in discussions to acquire credit firm Bardin Hill Investment Partners, according to people with knowledge of the matter.

title: Recruiter Woes Compound as Tariffs Sting Global Labor Markets
content: Recruiters across Europe and the US had a dismal start to the year. US President Donald Trump’s tariffs are now dimming their prospects for the rest of 2025.

title: EU Goes on Offense to Retain Firms and Counter Trump’s Tariffs
content: The European Union is planning to counter President Donald Trump’s efforts to lure companies to the US by easing the bloc’s regulatory burden on sectors from autos to chemicals to aeronautics.

title: Nigeria Overhauls Colonial-Era Tax Rules in Pro-Business Push
content: Halfway into a four-year tenure, President Bola Tinubu’s push to reform the floundering economy of Africa’s most-populous country has received the most significant thrust yet: An overhaul of tax laws, some that date back to Nigeria’s colonial past.

title: China’s Consumer Deflation Extends as Tariffs Take Toll
content: China’s consumer deflation extended for a third month in April as punitive tariffs imposed by the US add to a drag on prices from weak domestic demand.

title: CATL Seeks at Least $4 Billion for Hong Kong Listing
content: Contemporary Amperex Technology Co. Ltd. is planning to seek at least $4 billion from its Hong Kong stock offering, people familiar with the matter said, which would make it the world’s biggest listing this year.

title: ECB Needs Steady Hand and Mustn’t Overdo Rate Cuts, Schnabel Says
content: The European Central Bank needs a “steady hand” and mustn’t lower borrowing costs too much as inflation could turn out to be higher in the future, Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel said.

title: S&P 500 Wavers After $6 Trillion Run on Trade Risk: Markets Wrap
content: Wall Street ended the week on a more cautious note, with stocks and bonds fluctuating as the world’s two largest economies get ready to kickstart their trade negotiations.

title: Global Funds Chase Asian Stocks as FX Surge Counters Trade Angst
content: Global funds are piling back into Asian stocks as the attraction of soaring currencies and resilient earnings offsets concern that higher US tariffs will sap the region’s economic growth.

title: Flock of Fed Speakers Show No Eagerness to Consider Rate Cuts
content: On a day when more than half of the Federal Reserve’s policymakers offered public remarks, not one made it sound like the US central bank was near lowering interest rates.

title: The Fed Decision, IRS Cutbacks, Ireland’s Corporate Tax | Wall Street Week
content: This week, former Treasury Secretary Lawrence H. Summers and Economist Kenneth Rogoff weigh the effects of President Trump's monetary policy. And, how will the IRS carry out its mandate under the Trump administration’s recent staff and funding cuts? Plus, across the pond, how will tariffs affect Ireland’s corporate tax policies that have attracted American companies to its shores? Later, academic leaders talk about colleges' handling of antisemitism and President Trump’s decision to cut federal funding for research. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Stock Indexes Finish Near Flat | Bloomberg: The Close 05/09/2025
content: Bloomberg Television brings you the latest news and analysis leading up to the final minutes and seconds before and after the closing bell on Wall Street. title: US Official Meets With Mexico Bankers on Cartel Financing Risks
content: A US Treasury Department official made an unannounced visit to Mexico’s annual banking convention to discuss stepping up efforts to combat organized-crime finances.

title: UrbanStems To Ship 4 Million Stems on Mother’s Day
content: UrbanStems expected to ship 4 million stems on this coming Mother’s Day. In an interview on "The Close" UrbanStems CEO Meenakshi Lala discusses the growth of the business, impact of tariffs, and how fast the company can support last minute orders. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Iran Says ‘Ridiculous’ It Would Send Missile Launchers to Russia
content: Iran dismissed claims that it plans to deliver missile launchers to Russia to support its war in Ukraine and called them “utterly ridiculous,” state-run IRIB News said, citing a statement from Iran’s mission to the United Nations in New York.

title: Trump’s Ally PM Seeks to Anchor Albania in Europe: What to Watch
content: Edi Rama seeks to win an unprecedented fourth term as prime minister, pledging to finally take Albania into the European Union and turn it into a hot tourist destination with some help from the Trump family.

title: India, Pakistan Reach US-Backed Truce Though Clashes Go On
content: India and Pakistan agreed to an immediate ceasefire mediated by the US, though each of the nuclear-armed powers soon accused the other of violating the truce.

title: Former Panama President Martinelli Heads for Asylum in Colombia
content: PANAMA CITY, Panama (AP) — Former Panamanian President Ricardo Martinelli left the Nicaraguan embassy in Panama City where he had sought refuge more than a year ago after the courts upheld a money laundering sentence against him and headed to Colombia where he has received political asylum, the government said late Saturday.

title: Trump Fires US Copyright Office Chief Perlmutter, Politico Says
content: President Donald Trump fired the top official at the US Copyright Office on Saturday, Politico reported.

title: UK Universities Must Be More Transparent With Public Money, Minister Says
content: Universities have "lost sight" of their responsibility concerning public money and should be more transparent about how it is spent, a Government minister has said.

title: Putin Offers Talks With Ukraine on May 15 But Skirts Truce
content: Russian President Vladimir Putin offered to hold direct talks with Ukraine in Istanbul on May 15, saying he didn’t rule out reaching an agreement on a ceasefire in the war.

title: Trump Hails Progress After First Day of US-China Trade Talks
content: Senior US and Chinese negotiators spent hours behind closed doors in Switzerland on Saturday as they held high-stakes talks that offer the clearest opportunity yet for the two countries to de-escalate their trade war, with President Donald Trump calling it a “very good” meeting.

title: Pope Leo XIV Identifies AI as a Major Challenge for Humanity
content: VATICAN CITY (AP) — Pope Leo XIV laid out the vision of his papacy Saturday, identifying artificial intelligence as one of the most critical matters facing humanity and vowing to continue with some of the core priorities of Pope Francis.

title: Trump Says ‘Much Agreed to’ in Meeting With Chinese Officials
content: President Donald Trump said US and Chinese negotiators in Switzerland had “a very good meeting” in an effort to de-escalate their trade war.

title: UK Proposes Tightening Visa Rules to Reduce Legal Migration
content: The UK government is seeking to tighten visa requirements to curb the number of workers arriving in the country through legal routes.

title: Once-Powerful NSC Is Sidelined by Trump as Rubio Takes the Helm
content: Donald Trump is taking his time naming a permanent replacement for his National Security Adviser. But he’s already sent a clear message: the job once held by figures like Henry Kissinger and Zbigniew Brzezinski won’t matter in his administration nearly as much.

title: Bangladesh Bans Awami League Party Under Anti-Terrorism Law
content: Bangladesh will ban the former ruling Awami League party under anti-terrorism law, the nation’s chief adviser’s office said in a statement, citing national security and the need to protect witnesses in criminal trials.

title: What’s Next on Russia Sanctions If Putin Balks at Ceasefire Call
content: With European leaders calling for a 30-day ceasefire in the war in Ukraine starting Monday and claiming President Donald Trump’s support for the ultimatum, the possibility of additional sanctions on Russia is moving into focus.

title: South Korea Conservatives Agree to Unify Presidential Campaign, Yonhap Says
content: South Korea’s conservative presidential hopefuls have agreed to end their rift, Yonhap News Agency reported, uniting behind a single candidate ahead of a snap election triggered by the impeachment of the country’s former president.

title: Elton John, Dua Lipa Urge UK to Rethink AI Copyright Plans
content: Top UK artists, including Paul McCartney, Elton John and Dua Lipa, urged Prime Minister Keir Starmer to strengthen copyright protections ahead of a critical vote on rules governing artificial intelligence next week.

title: India, Pakistan Signal Intent to Ease Tensions After Strikes
content: India and Pakistan signaled they are willing to de-escalate after strikes on military bases by both sides on Saturday raised fears of all-out war between the nuclear-armed nations and prompted warnings from the US and China.

title: Trump Must Halt Mass Layoffs of Federal Workers, Judge Rules
content: The Trump administration must temporarily cease from engaging in widespread layoffs and firings for government workers, a California federal court ruled Friday.

title: India and Pakistan’s Information War Is More Heated Than Ever
content: As India and Pakistan wage their first major armed conflict since 2019, on the airwaves and internet a full-blown war has already broken out, pressing government officials, news outlets and citizens from both sides into battle.

title: US to Probe Reports of Swabs on Its Citizens Arriving in China
content: The US embassy in China said it received reports that American citizens are being subjected to “invasive medical testing” upon arrival in the country.

title: Why the World Keeps Getting Shocked by China’s Technological Progress
content: Understanding the cultural element of tech diffusion.

title: Indians Hoard Food, Cancel Trips Amid Escalating Armed Conflict
content: Many Indians, especially those living in areas closer to the Pakistan border, have started hoarding essentials and canceling travel plans amid a rapid escalation in military conflict between the two nuclear-armed nations.

title: India, Pakistan Move Closer to Full War After Bases Targeted
content: Pakistan and India moved closer to all-out war as each said they struck the other’s military sites in the early hours of Saturday.

title: EU Goes on Offense to Retain Firms and Counter Trump’s Tariffs
content: The European Union is planning to counter President Donald Trump’s efforts to lure companies to the US by easing the bloc’s regulatory burden on sectors from autos to chemicals to aeronautics.

title: Europe in Talks With US Over Ultimatum to End War in Ukraine
content: Senior European officials are in talks with the Trump administration to finalize an agreement on a 30-day ceasefire in Ukraine that would impose new sanctions on Russia if President Vladimir Putin doesn’t budge, said people familiar with the matter.

title: Keir Starmer’s Trump Win Fails to Calm Labour Party’s Worries About Farage
content: Keir Starmer’s double victory in securing trade deals with India and the US this week still isn’t enough to pacify restive lawmakers in the UK’s governing Labour Party.

title: Malaysia Extends Anti-Graft Chief’s Term by a Year, Bernama Says
content: Malaysia extended the term of anti-corruption agency head Azam Baki, according to state media Bernama, in a move that’s likely to draw criticism of Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s government.

title: Columbia Launches Research Stabilization Funds After Trump Cuts
content: Columbia University has launched two research stabilization funds after US President Donald Trump pulled $400 million from its funding, according to a post on its website written by the school’s Acting President Claire Shipman.

title: Malaysia’s Rafizi to Face Anwar’s Daughter in Party Polls
content: Malaysia’s Economy Minister Rafizi Ramli will compete against Prime Minister Anwar Ibrahim’s daughter for their party’s deputy presidency, a development that’s set to heighten tensions in the country’s ruling bloc.

title: House Tax Panel Releases Partial Version of Trump Bill
content: The House Ways and Means Committee on Friday night released a partial version of President Donald Trump’s tax proposal that calls for increasing the maximum child tax credit to $2,500 and raising the estate tax exemption to $15 million.

title: Africa's Bid to Host a Formula 1 Grand Pix
content: Formula 1 cars last raced in Africa in 1993, but now investors and governments are making a concerted effort to bring motor racing's elite series back to the continent with South Africa, Rwanda and Morocco counted as potential hosts. Jennifer Zabasajja reports. (Source: Bloomberg)

content: European leaders meet Zelenskiy at the Maidan Nezalezhnosti in Kyiv, to honor fallen Ukrainian soldiers. title: Whoop Reverses Course After Customer Backlash on Upgrade Fees

content: Over the last several years, the world has watched as China edges close to or past the technological frontier in more and more areas. Earlier this year, US investors were jolted even further when DeepSeek’s AI model proved to be close to the state of the art American models. title: Alphabet Shares Take $138 Billion Blow as Search Warnings Blare
content: For more than a year, Alphabet Inc. shareholders have fretted over long-term risks posed by artificial intelligence to the company’s money-printing search business. This week the threat became much more immediate.

title: Bain Capital Is Talks to Buy PCI Pharma at a $10 Billion Valuation
content: Bain Capital is in talks to buy PCI Pharma Services, people with knowledge of the matter said, in a deal that would rank among the year’s largest private equity takeovers.

title: Apple Eyes AI Server Chips, Lyft CEO Talks Growth Plans | Bloomberg Technology
content: Bloomberg’s Caroline Hyde and Ed Ludlow discuss the possible impact of trade talks between the US and China. Plus, Lyft CEO David Risher talks about the markets where the company is investing. And, DraftKings CEO, Jason Robins, explains the impact of a surprising March Madness. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Ex-Palantir Adviser to Keep SpaceX, OpenAI Stakes in Trump Role
content: Former Palantir Technologies Inc. adviser Jacob Helberg plans to retain investments in dozens of artificial intelligence, defense and fintech companies as he starts his tenure as an under secretary of state in Donald Trump’s administration.

title: Sonos Interim CEO Says Company Has Turned a Corner and He Wants the Top Job
content: Sonos Inc. interim Chief Executive Officer Tom Conrad said the audio company has “turned the corner” following setbacks caused by software issues — and that he wants to be named to the top job permanently.

title: Zscaler's Chaudhry Stays Bullish Despite Tariffs, DOGE Fallout

content: Simo will oversee executives and seek to broaden the company's hit chatbot into a Swiss Army knife of artificial intelligence software.

title: ‘Grand Theft Auto VI’ Delay Impacts Every Game Company
content: When Rockstar pushed back the release of the highly anticipated title, some game makers breathed a sigh of relief. Others are holding emergency meetings.

title: CoreWeave in Talks for $1.5 Billion Debt Deal 6 Weeks After IPO
content: Less than two months after a heavily scaled down initial public offering, CoreWeave Inc. is in discussions to raise about $1.5 billion in debt, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Ether Surges 30% in Best Week Since 2021 as Trade Tensions Ease
content: Ether led a broad cryptocurrency rally this week, heading for its strongest gains since 2021, bolstered by easing global trade tensions and optimism over a network upgrade.

title: US Probes Role of CrowdStrike Bosses in Carahsoft Deal
content: US prosecutors and regulators investigating a $32 million deal between CrowdStrike Holdings Inc. and a technology distributor are probing what senior company executives may have known about it and are examining other transactions made by the cybersecurity firm, according to two people familiar with the matter.

content: Over the past decade, the software company has become a pillar of US cyber defenses — a position that could become more complicated under Trump.

content: HoYoverse plots a future path to reach further than its anime roots

title: Panasonic to Slash 10,000 Jobs in Shift to Data, Energy Storage
content: Panasonic Holdings Corp. is slashing headcount by 10,000, or more than 4%, part of a push to cull non-growth operations and boost profitability.

title: Apple Device Management Pioneer Jamf to Expand to Android
content: Jamf Holding Corp., best known for helping businesses manage and secure Apple Inc. devices, will begin offering mobile management services for Android users.

title: Citigroup Seeks Namibia, Benin Business as Investment Jumps
content: Citigroup Inc. is in talks with African governments including Namibia and Benin to boost business as investment flows into the countries.

content: Companies are working on technologies from batteries to AI that can help ensure renewables and more electricity demand don’t threaten the grid.

title: Europe’s Gig Economy Is Consolidating Under US Ownership
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Natalie Lung looks at how US gig economy companies are leveraging domestic success into an aggressive strategy to go global.

title: Tech Industry Warns US Investment Pledges Hinge on Research Tax Break
content: Major tech companies lobbying to salvage a tax deduction for research and development are warning they may pull back from high-profile pledges of new US investments if Congress doesn’t fully reinstate the break.

title: China’s Top Chipmaker SMIC Warns Production Issues Hit Sales
content: Semiconductor Manufacturing International Corp. plunged Friday after China’s leading chipmaker warned sales could fall as much as 6% this quarter because of production disruptions.

title: Nintendo Doesn’t Rule Out Switch Price Hike After Soft Outlook
content: Nintendo Co. warned it may yet increase the cost of its long-anticipated new console, after projecting weaker-than-expected initial sales of the Switch 2.

title: DeepSeek Punctured the Myth That Silicon Valley Could Control AI
content: In just two years, China’s open-source artificial intelligence movement allowed it to virtually close the gap with its US peers.

title: Swissquote Seeks to Shake Crypto Link Despite 1,500% Stock Rally
content: When Swissquote Group Holding SA became the first European bank to let clients trade Bitcoin in 2017, the cryptocurrency was changing hands for around $2,000 per token.

title: Trump Hails Progress After First Day of US-China Trade Talks
content: Senior US and Chinese negotiators spent hours behind closed doors in Switzerland on Saturday as they held high-stakes talks that offer the clearest opportunity yet for the two countries to de-escalate their trade war, with President Donald Trump calling it a “very good” meeting.

title: US Inflation Starting to Stir as Trump Tariff Threat Looms
content: US consumer prices probably picked up in April after the smallest advance in nine months, foreshadowing a broader acceleration as many companies seek to pass on higher tariffs.

title: ECB’s Vujcic Expects Inflation to Slow to 2% Target by Year-End
content: Consumer-price growth will hit the European Central Bank’s 2% target by the end of 2025, according to Governing Council member Boris Vujcic.

title: UK Chancellor Reeves Set to Review ISAs Within Weeks, FT Reports
content: The UK Chancellor of the Exchequer Rachel Reeves is preparing to launch a review of the market for Individual Savings Accounts within weeks, the Financial Times reported Saturday.

title: Decoupling Threatens China’s Enduring Interest in US Capital
content: In the US, Chinese insurance broker Yuanbao Inc. isn’t a household name on Main Street. It’s unlikely to be known by many on Wall Street, either.

title: Charting the Global Economy: Bank of England Eases, Fed Holds
content: The Bank of England lowered interest rates by a quarter percentage point and maintained its gradual-easing approach as officials assess US trade policy risks that also explain the Federal Reserve’s decision to remain sidelined.

title: Recruiter Woes Compound as Tariffs Sting Global Labor Markets
content: Recruiters across Europe and the US had a dismal start to the year. US President Donald Trump’s tariffs are now dimming their prospects for the rest of 2025.

title: Egyptian Inflation Little Changed With More Rate Cuts on Horizon
content: Egyptian inflation slightly accelerated for a second month, an anticipated quickening driven by a cut in fuel subsidies that’s unlikely to put the brakes on a long-awaited monetary-easing cycle.

title: EU Goes on Offense to Retain Firms and Counter Trump’s Tariffs
content: The European Union is planning to counter President Donald Trump’s efforts to lure companies to the US by easing the bloc’s regulatory burden on sectors from autos to chemicals to aeronautics.

title: Nigeria Overhauls Colonial-Era Tax Rules in Pro-Business Push
content: Halfway into a four-year tenure, President Bola Tinubu’s push to reform the floundering economy of Africa’s most-populous country has received the most significant thrust yet: An overhaul of tax laws, some that date back to Nigeria’s colonial past.

title: Eurovision Fans Find Swiss Franc’s Latest Surge Hits a Sour Note
content: As many as half a million fans heading to Basel for the Eurovision Song Contest next week are about to discover that Swiss prices stoked by the franc’s gains are far from music to their ears.

title: China’s Consumer Deflation Extends as Tariffs Take Toll
content: China’s consumer deflation extended for a third month in April as punitive tariffs imposed by the US add to a drag on prices from weak domestic demand.

title: ECB Needs Steady Hand and Mustn’t Overdo Rate Cuts, Schnabel Says
content: The European Central Bank needs a “steady hand” and mustn’t lower borrowing costs too much as inflation could turn out to be higher in the future, Executive Board member Isabel Schnabel said.

title: Trump Says 80% China Tariff ‘Seems Right,’ Ahead of Talks
content: President Donald Trump floated an 80% tariff on China ahead of negotiations due to begin Saturday as he urged Beijing to do more to open their markets to US goods.

title: Flock of Fed Speakers Show No Eagerness to Consider Rate Cuts
content: On a day when more than half of the Federal Reserve’s policymakers offered public remarks, not one made it sound like the US central bank was near lowering interest rates.

title: Argentina Halts Private Bond Sale Amid Pressure on Peso Rate
content: Argentina’s central bank intervened to stop a dollar bond sale by Banco Supervielle halfway through the trading day on Friday, according to two people with knowledge of the matter, a move that could avert pressure on the peso in the parallel exchange market.

title: US Official Meets With Mexico Bankers on Cartel Financing Risks
content: A US Treasury Department official made an unannounced visit to Mexico’s annual banking convention to discuss stepping up efforts to combat organized-crime finances.

title: Fed Governor Michelle Bowman Hires Staffers From Goldman, Davis Polk and BPI
content: US Federal Reserve Governor Michelle Bowman, who’s on track to become vice chair for supervision, has turned to the banking world for three staff picks, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Trump Says 10% Tariff Baseline Unless ‘Exceptional’ Offer Made
content: President Donald Trump said that he would “always” impose a minimum 10% tariff on trading partners — before quickly adding that “there could be an exception,” underscoring the difficulty discerning the US approach to dozens of trade deals under negotiation.

title: Bessent Says Debt Limit Measures Could Run Out in August
content: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent told US lawmakers that his department’s ability to use special accounting maneuvers to stay within the federal debt limit could be exhausted in August.

title: Seattle Businesses Take Canadian Cash at Par to Lure Sports Fans
content: For years, the arrival of the Toronto Blue Jays in Seattle brought a familiar sight: tens of thousands of exuberant Canadians pouring into the city to cheer on their baseball team.

title: Mexico Finance Chief Says USMCA-Protected Exports Bolster Growth
content: Mexico’s finance chief Edgar Amador said the North American free trade agreement should continue to bolster the economy despite the threat that the US could push for major changes to it.

title: IMF Approves $1 Billion Pakistan Payment Over India Protest
content: The International Monetary Fund’s executive board on Friday approved a roughly $1 billion loan disbursements to Pakistan, bringing some relief for the nation’s fragile finances amid its worsening conflict with neighboring India.

title: US Stocks End Week Lower as Investors Look Ahead to China Talks
content: US stocks closed little changed Friday to notch a small weekly loss as traders weighed comments from President Donald Trump suggesting that an 80% tariff on China seemed right, just as negotiations between the two countries are set to begin on Saturday.

title: Ghana’s Credit Rating Raised by S&P After Spending Cut Plans
content: Ghana’s credit rating was raised by S&P Global Ratings after the new administration unveiled plans to rein in spending as the West African nation recovers from a painful debt restructuring.

title: Ghana’s Debt Burden Seen Falling Sharply on Economic Expansion
content: Ghana’s debt burden will ease sharply this year as the economy expands and the government reins in spending after a debt crisis, Barclays Plc said.

title: Warsh Suggests Fed’s Tariff Remarks Imply Impaired Credibility
content: Kevin Warsh, who is seen as a possible contender to be the next Federal Reserve chair, suggested the US central bank would be at fault if it cannot prevent tariff-related price hikes from leading to a persistent rise in inflation.

title: Trump’s Priority List for Tariff Talks Homes In on Around 20 Economies
content: The Trump administration’s first trade talks involve an eclectic mix of major exporters and smaller economies, as the White House looks to rack up agreements that could serve as models for other negotiations.

title: What to Know About the US-China Trade War as Talks Begin
content: The future of one of the world’s biggest trading relationships hangs in the balance after US President Donald Trump escalated the tariff war with China by imposing steep duties on imports from the country.

title: Options Traders Flock to Wager That Fed Won’t Cut Interest Rates
content: A contrarian wager that the Federal Reserve won’t cut interest rates this year is exploding in the options market.

title: Cutting Newark Flights Is Temporary Fix for Long-Term Crisis
content: Airline chief executives are poised to work with US aviation officials to throttle back more Newark airport flights, a fix that may ease short-term safety concerns but won’t solve long-term challenges.

title: Canadian Telecom Firms Blame Immigration Policies for Mobile Subscriber Slowdown
content: For years, Canada’s top telecom providers rode a wave of high immigration, collectively adding hundreds of thousands of new mobile phone subscribers most quarters. Those days are over.

title: Officials, Airlines to Talk Newark Reductions After Outages
content: Airlines and aviation officials plan to meet on May 14 to discuss further flight cutbacks at Newark airport following multiple breakdowns in radar systems.

title: Newark Airport Hit by Another 90-Second Radar Outage
content: Air traffic controllers guiding planes in and out of Newark Liberty International Airport briefly lost communications and radar displays early Friday morning, the second outage in as many weeks affecting the transportation hub.

title: Trump Opens Door to Tariffs on Commercial Aircraft, Engines
content: The Trump administration is probing whether imported aircraft, jet engines and parts represent a threat to national security, a precursor to imposing new tariffs targeting the commercial aerospace industry.

title: US Official Meets With Mexico Bankers on Cartel Financing Risks
content: A US Treasury Department official made an unannounced visit to Mexico’s annual banking convention to discuss stepping up efforts to combat organized-crime finances.

title: Kohl’s Board Fight Spills Out After Director Departure

title: Hedge Funds Soured on Oil as OPEC Agreed to Bumper Supply Hike
content: Hedge funds turned the least bullish on Brent crude in about six months as OPEC+ agreed to a second major production increase, inflaming concerns that the extra supply could lead to a global glut.

title: Tufts Grad Student Öztürk Is Freed on Bail in Trump Setback
content: A federal judge freed a Turkish graduate student on bail while she fights possible deportation over the Trump administration’s claims of antisemitism in an op-ed she helped write.

title: Sarepta’s Week Goes From Bad to Worse on FDA Fears, Outlook Cut
content: Sarepta Therapeutics Inc. capped its worst week in four years as disappointing earnings and regulatory fears hit the drugmaker’s shares.

title: Oil Rises as Focus Shifts to US-China Trade Talks After UK Deal
content: Oil rose as algorithmic traders fled short positions amid renewed optimism about trade talks between the US and China this weekend.

title: Nestle to Raise Prices of Some US Chocolate on High Cocoa Costs
content: Nestle USA is increasing prices for some chocolate products due to commodity costs, a sign that sweet treats will stay expensive for consumers in the near term.

title: US Measles Cases Surpass 1,000 as Texas Infection Rate Slows
content: The US has confirmed 1,001 measles cases since the outbreak began in January, even as the virus’ spread in the hardest-hit state has slowed.

title: Stellantis Nears CEO Decision With US Boss a Top Contender
content: Stellantis NV is approaching the end of its complicated search for a new chief executive officer, with Americas boss Antonio Filosa emerging as the leading candidate, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: CoreWeave in Talks for $1.5 Billion Debt Deal 6 Weeks After IPO
content: Less than two months after a heavily scaled down initial public offering, CoreWeave Inc. is in discussions to raise about $1.5 billion in debt, according to a person with knowledge of the matter.

title: Santander Rejected Bid of About £11 Billion for UK Unit, FT Says

title: Bankrupt Federal Contractor Seeks Fast Sale to Avoid DOGE Threat

title: Zepbound Patients Fear Losing Coverage After CVS Deal for Wegovy

title: Germany’s New Finance Minister Backs Commerzbank Independence

content: And we also have to give the House Republican moderates some credit (for now).

content: From credit cards and mortgage rates to auto loans and savings accounts, all sorts of consumer borrowing costs are impacted by Fed moves.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.

title: China, US Step Back from Decoupling Brink, Slash Tariffs | Bloomberg The Pulse 05/12
content:
US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products in a dramatic ratcheting down of trade tensions that buys the world’s two largest economies three months to work toward a broader agreement. The combined 145% US levies on most Chinese imports will be reduced to 30% including the rate tied to fentanyl by May 14, while the 125% Chinese duties on US goods will drop to 10%, according to a joint statement and from officials in a briefing Monday in Geneva.

Today's guests: Wei Li, BlackRock Global Chief Investment Strategist, Odile Renaud-Basso, EBRD President, Kyriakos Pierrakakis, Greek Finance Minister.  (Source: Bloomberg)

title: ‘Decisive Moment’ in Trade Talks Puts China Rally Back on Track
content: China’s stock market investors just got the news they have been hoping for.

title: Pakistani, Indian Stocks Soar as Truce Shifts Focus to Growth
content: Stocks in Pakistan and India rallied as a ceasefire agreement between the two nuclear-armed neighbors calmed markets that had been shaken by military clashes on their border.

title: Trump Vows US Drug Price Cuts of Up to 80% in Industry Blow
content: President Donald Trump said he plans to order a cut in US prescription drug costs by mandating that Americans pay no more than people in countries that have the lowest price.

title: US, China Agree to Lower Tariffs
content: The US and China will temporarily lower tariffs on each other’s products, in a move to cool trade tensions and give the world’s two largest economies three more months to resolve their differences. The decision was announced at a briefing by US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent and Trade Representative Jamieson Greer. (Source: Bloomberg)

title: Southern Spain Outages Preceded Nationwide Blackout, Report Says
content: Power failures in southern Spain preceded a nationwide blackout that left millions in the dark two weeks ago, according to the most detailed report yet on the events leading up to the debacle.

title: US Stock Futures and Dollar Surge on Tariff Truce: Market Wrap
content: Investors rushed back into US assets, powering a more than 3% surge in S&P 500 futures, after China and the US agreed to cut tariffs and de-escalate a trade war that had sown turmoil in global markets. Treasuries and gold tumbled.

title: ould Tariffs Hurt Hydrogen's Lofty Promises?: BNEF
content: Clean hydrogen had been touted as a key fuel to help the world decarbonize, but enthusiasm for the fuel is waning. title: ‘Buy America’ Sweeps Across Global Markets After China-US Talks
content: With the temporary truce between the US and China kicking off another equity rally, American stocks are now trading like Donald Trump’s “Liberation Day” shock never happened.

title: Oil Leads Commodity Rally After US-China Truce as Gold Retreats
content: Oil powered higher with most other commodities, while gold fell, after China and the US agreed to lower tariffs on each other, following a weekend of trade talks.

title: India’s Top Cinema Chain Banks on Bollywood Recovery as Movie-Goers Dip
content: India’s top cinema chain PVR Inox Ltd. is betting on a slew of Hollywood and Bollywood releases to bring back moviegoers after a lackluster year.
