content: Companies are working on technologies from batteries to AI that can help ensure renewables and more electricity demand don’t threaten the grid.

title: AI Startup Perplexity Nears Funding at $14 Billion Value
content: Perplexity AI Inc., a startup building an artificial intelligence search engine to compete with Google, is in advanced discussions to raise a new round of funding at a $14 billion valuation — a jump from its most recent value but lower than it was initially targeting.

title: Bulgarians Who Spied for Russia Sentenced to Jail by UK Judge
content: Six Bulgarian nationals who were part of a Russian spy ring run by Wirecard’s fugitive ex-chief operating officer were sentenced to as long as 10 years in prison by a London judge.

title: Pritzker Scores Quantum Win as Australian Firm Picks Chicago Hub
content: Illinois’s quantum campus, championed by Governor JB Pritzker, is adding an Australian tech firm to its list of future tenants on Chicago’s South Side, advancing his push to make the state a hub for the industry.

title: Telefonica Hires Citi for Chile Unit Sale, El Confidencial Says
content: Telefonica SA mandated Citigroup Inc. to manage the sale of its Chilean unit, after the Spanish-based company offloaded many of its other subsidiaries in Latin America.

title: SoftBank Stargate Venture With OpenAI Snags on Tariff Fears
content: SoftBank Group Corp.’s plans to invest $100 billion in artificial intelligence infrastructure in the US have slowed, with economic risks stemming from Washington’s tariffs holding up financing talks.

title: Saudi Arabia Launches New AI Firm Ahead of Trump’s Visit
content: Saudi Arabia has launched a new firm to invest across the artificial intelligence value chain, ahead of a visit by US President Donald Trump, where the technology is expected to feature prominently on the agenda.

title: The iPhone Is a Nicer Place With Fewer Restrictions After Ruling
content: Welcome to Tech In Depth, our daily newsletter with reporting and analysis about the business of tech from Bloomberg’s journalists around the world. Today, Austin Carr looks at the impact of the latest ruling ordering Apple to reform its App Store practices.

title: Laurence Tosi’s WestCap Backs Digital Infrastructure Startup
content: A private markets veteran is betting there’s money to be made by bringing better technology to his industry.

title: Air-Taxi Startup Vertical Goes Hybrid in Pivot Toward Defense
content: Vertical Aerospace Ltd is building a hybrid variant of its battery-powered air taxi, in a bet that a longer-range aircraft will attract investment from the lucrative defense sector.

title: Mazda Withholds Profit Guidance as Suzuki Dodges Trump’s Tariffs
content: Mazda Motor Co. withheld its annual profit guidance after its short-term future, along with most global carmakers, was muddied by US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Xiaomi Shares Drop as Consumers Complain About Marketing of EVs
content: Xiaomi Corp. shares dropped as much as 5.7% in Hong Kong on Monday after a local media report over the weekend that said more than 300 people want to cancel their SU7 Ultra electric vehicle orders on “false advertising” about the design of the vehicle’s hood.

title: VC Firm Backed by Golub Family Office Starts Mideast-US AI Fund
content: A Saudi Arabia-based venture capital firm that’s backed by the family office of US billionaire Lawrence Golub is launching a $50 million fund to invest in artificial intelligence startups across the Middle East and the San Francisco Bay Area.

title: AI Drug Firm METiS Considering $200 Million Hong Kong IPO, Sources Say
content: Artificial intelligence-driven drug firm METiS Pharmaceuticals is considering an initial public offering in Hong Kong to raise as much as $200 million, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Amazon-Backed Scale AI Plans Middle East Expansion With New Saudi Arabia Office
content: Scale AI, a startup backed by Amazon.com Inc. that helps companies develop artificial intelligence products, plans to open an office in Saudi Arabia by the end of the year in a broader regional expansion.

title: UK Firms Cut Jobs for Third Month as Tax Hike, Trade War Hit
content: British businesses cut jobs for a third straight month in April as a £26 billion ($34 billion) tax hike took effect and Donald Trump’s tariffs darkened the global economic outlook.

title: Bessent Says EU May Have a ‘Collective Action Problem’ on Trade
content: US Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent downplayed the possibility of a quick trade agreement with the European Union, saying the bloc suffers from a “collective action problem” that’s hampering negotiations.

title: Xi Courts Latin America as Trump’s Tariffs Pressure Region
content: Chinese President Xi Jinping vowed to deepen economic cooperation with Latin American and Caribbean nations and offered visa-free entry to some countries, as he seeks to position China as a better partner than the US.

title: Romanian Inflation Stays Flat as Political Risks Cloud Outlook
content: Romanian inflation remained unchanged last month as the gravest political crisis since the collapse of communism pushed the leu to a record low which will likely intensify price pressure and complicate the central bank’s wait-and-see approach to monetary policy in the coming month.

title: India Proposes First Counter Move Against Trump’s Tariff Regime
content: India has proposed levies on some US goods in response to Washington’s duties on steel and aluminum, marking its first retaliation against President Donald Trump’s tariff regime, even as the two countries move closer to finalizing a trade deal.

title: China Removes Ban on Boeing Deliveries After US Trade Truce
content: China has removed a month-long ban on airlines taking delivery of Boeing Co. planes, according to people familiar with the matter, following a breakthrough in trade talks with the US that temporarily slashed tariffs on each side.

title: Slovakia, Hungary Seen Among Worst Hit by Tariffs, EBRD Says
content: Eastern European countries are expected to be among the economies worst hit by risks related to trade tariffs, according to the European Bank for Reconstruction and Development.

title: Trump Faces $2 Trillion Hurdle to Win Money From Saudi Prince
content: US President Donald Trump’s hopes of securing as much as $1 trillion in investment commitments from Saudi Arabia might clash with another costly ambition - transforming the kingdom’s own economy.

title: Foreigners’ Interest in US Job Postings Slumps in Indeed Data
content: The burst of foreign interest in US jobs following the Covid-19 pandemic has all but vanished, a shift that threatens to exacerbate labor shortages in industries such as health care.

title: Chinese Rare Earth Firms Ask for Official Clarity on US Exports
content: Chinese rare-earth exporters are asking the government to clarify whether they’re allowed to sell to the US, after Beijing and Washington called a ceasefire in their trade war.

title: Nomura Turns Bullish on China’s Stocks After Trade Truce With US
content: Nomura Holdings Inc. strategists upgraded Chinese stocks to a ‘tactical overweight,’ saying the trade truce between the US and China is a significant positive for the Asian nation’s equities.

title: BOJ Still Eyeing Rate Hikes While Wary of Tariffs, Summary Shows
content: Bank of Japan board members signaled their intention for further rate hikes while citing the need to stay vigilant due the potential economic impacts from US tariff measures, according to a summary of opinions from their April 30-May 1 meeting.

title: Tariffs Create World Challenges, Opportunities, WTO Head Says
content: The global trade war with its persistent barrage of tariff developments provides both challenges and opportunities, according to Ngozi Okonjo-Iweala, the Director General of the World Trade Organisation.

title: Australia’s Business Conditions Ease, Boosting Case for RBA Cuts
content: Australian business conditions eased in April as profitability weakened, forward orders slipped and firms’ spending plans took a hit, boosting the case for the Reserve Bank to cut interest rates to support the economy.

title: Bond Traders Eye Inflation for Rate Clues as Recession Odds Fade
content: The temporary US-China trade truce dimmed the odds of a recession and sparked a selloff in Treasuries, raising the stakes for investors ahead of the release of inflation figures for the world’s biggest economy.

title: US Inflation Seen Picking Up in April With Modest Tariffs Impact
content: US inflation likely accelerated in April after an unexpected cooldown the previous month, with higher tariffs on Chinese goods in particular starting to impact prices.

title: New Yorkers Vow to Block House GOP Tax Bill Over SALT Limit
content: Two New York Republican lawmakers promised to block their party’s signature tax legislation unless GOP leaders raise a proposed $30,000 limit on the federal income tax deduction for state and local taxes.

title: Lula and Xi to Ink New Deals as Brazil Shrugs Off Trump’s Trade Threats
content: Brazil’s Luiz Inacio Lula da Silva insists he doesn’t want to pick between the US and China as his two largest trading partners wage a trade war. But it’s increasingly clear which side he’d choose if forced.

title: SALT, Tips and Auto Loans: A Guide to the House GOP Tax Bill
content: House Republicans’ release of the tax provisions in their massive fiscal bill provides a crucial initial reading of what party leaders think could pass, culminating weeks of intense negotiations among fractious GOP lawmakers.

title: US-China Truce Likely to Avert Recession But Not Coming Slowdown
content: The Trump administration’s temporary trade deal with China didn’t arrive in time to prevent a slowdown in the US economy, forecasters say, even if it reduces the risk of a full-blown recession later this year.

title: GOP to Phase Out Biden Energy Credits to Pay for Tax Cuts
content: House Republicans are proposing to eliminate a tax credit for electric vehicles and phase out incentives to develop clean-energy projects to help pay for President Donald Trump’s massive tax package.

title: Traders See Fed Cutting Rates Just Twice in 2025 on Cooling Trade War
content: Traders lowered their bets on the Federal Reserve’s interest-rate cuts this year, pricing in just two reductions for 2025 after the US and China agreed to cut tariffs and moderate their trade war.

title: Alberta Freezes Industrial Carbon Tax to Help Firms as Tariffs Hurt Economy
content: Alberta is freezing its industrial carbon tax in a bid to help companies struggling with the effects of US tariffs, potentially setting up a challenge to the government of Prime Minister Mark Carney.

title: Fed’s Kugler Sees Significant Tariff Impact Despite Recent News
content: Federal Reserve Governor Adriana Kugler said the Trump administration’s tariff policies are likely to boost inflation and weigh on economic growth, even with the recently announced reduction in levies on China.

title: State AI Regulation Ban Tucked Into Republican Tax, Fiscal Bill
content: A powerful House committee has tucked language preventing states from regulating artificial intelligence into President Donald Trump’s massive tax and spending bill, a move that would benefit many of the US’s largest tech and AI companies.

title: ECB’s Kazaks Sees Reason for Another Rate Cut, But Urges Caution
content: European Central Bank Governing Council member Martins Kazaks urged for caution even as he backed a further reduction in borrowing costs.

title: US Tariff Revenue Jumped in April, Before China De-Escalation
content: The US collected a record amount of revenue from tariffs in April, helping to limit a further widening of the budget deficit, though President Donald Trump’s search for trade deals with targeted nations may scale back future amounts collected.

title: Italy’s ESM Refusal Adds Risk Factor, Top EU Officials Warn
content: Italy’s failure to ratify the European Stability Mechanism bailout fund leaves the bloc with less protection in case of a future banking crisis, top officials warned.

title: World Bank Sees Nigeria’s Revenues Surging If Import Bans Lifted
content: Lifting Nigeria’s high tariffs and import bans could significantly increase tax revenue for Africa’s most populous country, the World Bank said.

title: BOE’s Taylor Warns of ‘Perilous’ Trade Threat After Urging Big Rate Cut
content: Bank of England policymaker Alan Taylor said interest rates are still a “long way” from moving out of restrictive levels, warning of the “perilous” threat from Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Munich Re Profit Halves on €1.1 Billion LA Wildfires Hit
content: Munich Re’s first-quarter profit slumped by almost half as losses from wildfires that ravaged swaths of the greater Los Angeles area weighed on earnings.

title: Bayer’s Earnings Beat Estimates On New Cancer, Kidney Drugs
content: Bayer AG’s earnings fell less than expected in the first quarter as robust demand for its new cancer and kidney medicines helped offset a decline in agricultural sales.

title: Pension Funds Agree to Invest 5% Into UK Private Assets
content: UK pension fund managers have agreed to invest at least 5% of their assets into UK private markets, marking a win for the Labour government that’s seeking to boost the economy by drawing billions of pounds into local startups and infrastructure projects.

title: Honda Signals Profit Drop as Carmakers Brace for Trump Tariffs
content: Honda Motor Co. issued a lukewarm profit forecast as it braced for the fallout of US President Donald Trump’s trade war.

title: Australian Family Office Plans 3,000 Homes on UK Golf Ranges
content: One of Australia’s richest family offices is drawing up plans to build more than £1 billion ($1.3 billion) worth of housing on land surrounding its UK golf courses, in one of the first major tests of the British government’s push to develop the nation’s green belt and turbocharge the economy.

title: Sabadell Said to Have Approached Unicaja Investors Over Deal
content: Banco Sabadell SA has held informal talks about a combination with Spanish lender Unicaja Banco SA as it seeks to head off a hostile takeover by larger rival BBVA SA, according to people familiar with the matter.

title: Nissan Shares Jump After Report Job Cuts to Double to 20,000
content: Nissan Motor Co. shares rallied on Tuesday after a report that the Japanese automaker will eliminate 11,000 more jobs than previously forecast as part of a plan to restructure its flailing business.

title: China Removes Ban on Boeing Deliveries After US Trade Truce
content: China has removed a month-long ban on airlines taking delivery of Boeing Co. planes, according to people familiar with the matter, following a breakthrough in trade talks with the US that temporarily slashed tariffs on each side.

title: Chinese Solar Stocks Surge on Reports of Planned Output Cuts
content: Chinese solar stocks jumped on Tuesday after local media reported a major firm was in talks with peers about an industry-wide output cut in a bid to support prices that have hit rock bottom due to oversupply.

title: Chinese Rare Earth Firms Ask for Official Clarity on US Exports
content: Chinese rare-earth exporters are asking the government to clarify whether they’re allowed to sell to the US, after Beijing and Washington called a ceasefire in their trade war.

title: Taiwan Insurers Hit by Losses in April on US Dollar Slump
content: Taiwan’s biggest insurers posted a total loss of almost NT$19 billion ($620 million) in April due to currency volatility after US President Donald Trump warned of a wave of global trade tariffs.

title: Vinpearl Shares Surge by Limit in Vietnamese Trading Debut
content: Shares of Vinpearl JSC jumped by the limit in their trading debut as the hospitality unit of Vietnam’s largest business empire became one of the country’s biggest listed companies.

title: Phillips 66 Holders Should Vote for Four Elliott Nominees, ISS Says
content: Shareholders of Phillips 66 should vote for all four board candidates nominated by activist investor Elliott Investment Management in its upcoming annual meeting, said proxy advisory firm Institutional Shareholder Services Inc.

title: Jon Voight Joins Studios, Unions to Press Trump for Film Aid
content: President Donald Trump’s Hollywood ambassadors joined studios, labor unions and producers in asking the White House to expand and extend tax incentives as part of an upcoming budget reconciliation bill.

title: Chinese Tycoon’s Son Barred From Leaving China Over Loan Dispute
content: The son of a Chinese property tycoon has been barred from leaving the country because of his involvement in a loan dispute, a person familiar with the matter said, highlighting the risks to executives caught up in a years-long real estate crisis.

title: Chinese Exporters Elated by Reprieve in US-China Trade War
content: The US-China deal temporarily lowering tariffs comes as a relief for Chinese exporters in limbo since the onset of a trade war between the world’s two largest economies.

title: Hertz Posts Worse-Than-Expected Loss After Shrinking Fleet
content: Hertz Global Holdings Inc. posted a larger-than-expected loss in the first quarter after the rental company shrank its fleet of cars and some customers slowed bookings.

title: China Tariff Relief Spurs Shipping Rush, Price Hike U-Turn
content: It may only be a 90-day reprieve from the steepest of Trump’s China tariffs, but it’s enough time to entice companies to restart factory operations and start shipping.

title: It’s Never Been Harder to Find Air Traffic Controllers — Look at Newark
content: The path to alleviating the shortage of air-traffic controllers runs through a training academy in Oklahoma City.

title: Transatlantic Summer Travel Expected to Fall Near Double Digits
content: Transatlantic travel this summer is set to cool substantially with demand from both sides of the Atlantic forecast to fall near double digits, according to data compiled by aviation analytics company Cirium.

title: Amazon, FedEx Reach Agreement for Large Package Delivery
content: Amazon.com Inc. has a multiyear agreement with FedEx Corp. to deliver large packages for the online retailer, renewing a relationship between the two companies that ended in 2019.

title: Republicans Revive Drug Middlemen Reforms in Budget Bill
content: House Republicans revived a set of policies that would change how prescription drug middlemen do business, as President Donald Trump again denounced the industry, sending shares of some of the companies down Monday.

title: McDonald’s Sets Out to Hire 375,000 US Workers This Summer
content: McDonald’s Corp. and its franchisees plan to recruit as many as 375,000 workers across the US this summer in what the burger chain says is its biggest hiring spree in years.

title: Walleye Cuts Credit, Commodities Teams to Focus on Core Groups
content: Walleye Capital dismissed its credit and commodities teams, eliminating those strategies as the hedge fund focuses on volatility, quantitative and fundamental long-short investing.

title: Alberta Freezes Industrial Carbon Tax to Help Firms as Tariffs Hurt Economy
content: Alberta is freezing its industrial carbon tax in a bid to help companies struggling with the effects of US tariffs, potentially setting up a challenge to the government of Prime Minister Mark Carney.

title: Newark Airspace Breakdowns Examined by FAA, Verizon Task Force
content: US aviation safety regulators formed an emergency task force to address technology breakdowns that briefly blinded air traffic controllers guiding planes in and out of Newark airport in recent weeks.

title: A Former TV Writer Found a Health-Care Loophole That Threatens to Blow Up Obamacare
content: How a former TV comedy writer’s fake-job loophole could blow up Obamacare.

title: Sean ‘Diddy’ Combs Says Love Life on Trial as State Alleges Plot
content: The prosecution against Sean Combs amounts to putting his sex and love life on trial, Combs’ attorney argued in opening statements.

title: UniCredit Shares Hit 14-Year High to Push Market Cap Past Intesa
content: UniCredit SpA’s share price rose to a 14-year high on Monday, lifting its market capitalization past rival Intesa Sanpaolo SpA to make it Italy’s largest bank by that metric.

title: Trump Wants Medicare to Pay Less Than Foreign Countries for Drugs
content: President Donald Trump is attempting to slash drug prices for Americans by more closely aligning their costs to lower prices paid abroad, renewing and expanding upon a failed push from his first term.

title: Pay off credit card debt: Woman shares how a nonprofit helped her
content: After a break up led a Massachusetts woman into $20,000 of credit card debt, she has independence, thanks to the help of a nonprofit. Here's her story.

title: A Republican Senator Puts on His Big-Boy Pants
content: And we also have to give the House Republican moderates some credit (for now).

title: Conservative Host Scorched For Setting The Bar 'Extremely Low' On Trump
content: Ben Ferguson called for the president to get more "credit" for his take on a "nonpartisan issue."

title: Rove, founded by a 22-year-old, is helping Gen Z earn airline miles without credit cards
content: During his junior year study abroad, Max Morganroth, traveled to 30 countries, primarily flying in business and first class. His jet-setting was funded

title: Crime is down in American cities. Will Trump take credit?
content: “If you’re under 55, this is probably the safest moment you’ve ever lived in.”

title: Is credit card debt forgiveness smart for seniors? Here's what experts think.
content: Debt forgiveness can provide relief for some seniors, but it's important to know when it is and isn't a wise move.

title: Trump slams Newsom after California governor proposes federal film tax credit to "Make America Film Again"
content: President Trump slammed Gavin Newsom on Tuesday, just hours after the California governor asked for collaboration on a massive national film tax credit.

title: Credit Suisse to pay $511M for helping Americans evade $4B in taxes
content: Credit Suisse has pleaded guilty to criminal charges and agreed to pay $511 million for helping wealthy Americans hide more than $4 billion.

title: The AP Will Not Change Nick Ut's Credit on 'Napalm Girl' Photo
content: The AP has released an extensive report looking at whether Nick Ut is the author of the Vietnam War Napalm Girl image.

title: Royal Credit Union partnering with local non-profits for diaper drive
content: Donations will be accepted between May 1 and May 31, 2025.

content: The SEC’s Office of Investor Education and Advocacy unveiled its anti-fraud public service campaign, which warns investors about the devastating impact relationship investment scams can have on their financial future.

content: April is Financial Literacy Month, and the SEC is encouraging investors to utilize the agency’s saving and investing resources on Investor.gov.

content:

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will hold four more roundtables in its ongoing series discussing crypto asset regulation.

content: The SEC&#039;s Crypto Task Force will host a series of roundtables to discuss key areas of interest in the regulation of crypto assets.

content:

content:
The Securities and Exchange Commission today announced the members of the Crypto Task Force staff, which is advising the Commission on matters related to crypto.

title: SEC to Host Roundtable on Artificial Intelligence
content: The SEC will hold a roundtable discussion on artificial intelligence and examine the risks, benefits, and governance of it in the financial industry.

title: How Embedded Finance Is Quietly Transforming Startup Business Models
content: Traditional banks are having a hard time keeping up with customers' expectations for embedded finance. In this guest commentary, Arthur Azizov, founder and investor at B2 Ventures, provides some answers to what customers want and why they want it.

title: Tariffs And The Venture Value Chain: A Blip Or Long-Term Pain?
content: Guest author Rohit Yadav takes us on an exploration of the value chain — VC fundraising, startup fundraising and exits — to see how tariffs are driving both direct and indirect impacts.

title: The Longer IPOs Delay, The Less Likely Debuts Will Happen
content: Over the past couple weeks, as we’ve seen Klarna, StubHub and others delay scheduled pre-IPO roadshows, it appears markets are to blame. But how will delays affect a company's success when it finally makes its debut?

title: Crypto Startup Ripple Buys Hidden Road For $1.25B
content: Crypto payments firm Ripple is acquiring brokerage house Hidden Road for $1.25 billion in one of the biggest M&A deals ever in crypto.

title: Tariffs, Volatility And The Startup Exit Dilemma
content: Even seasoned startup investors today face what feels like a novel turn of events: a potential recession and increasing exit uncertainty due to government-induced volatility, writes guest author Don Butler of Thomvest Ventures.  For an ecosystem that has long awaited the return of robust exit volumes, the uncertainty in the markets sparked by tariffs couldn’t come at a worse time.

title: CoreWeave Closes Flat In First-Day Trading
content: Shares of CoreWeave closed flat at $40 on their first day of trading on the Nasdaq today. Shares had opened at $39 on Friday, a day when the Nasdaq sank 2.7%.

title: CoreWeave Shrinks IPO
content: Cloud computing startup CoreWeave is cutting the size of its IPO, looking for a valuation closer to $23 billion than the roughly $30 billion it had originally targeted.

title: Want To Sell Your Startup Quickly To A Strategic Buyer? Consider This From The Get-Go
content: Whether buying a startup or selling one, there are plenty of steps that need to be considered, writes guest author Murat Abdrakhmanov. In this commentary he provides recommendations to help both buyer and seller reach their strategic and financial goals.

title: The Most-Active, Spendiest Startup Investors Are Lagging Greatly In Lucrative Exits
content: The most active, highest-spending startup investors are leading a lot of large new rounds lately. When it comes to exits, however, things look much, much slower. We used Crunchbase data to examine IPO and M&A exits since 2023 for six firms that regularly top our active lead investor rankings.

title: Forget Startups. Maybe The Most Adaptable Companies Are Those That Last Centuries
content: Building a lasting business can take an exceedingly long time, but it's nothing compared to hundreds of well-known, successful organizations and brands that can trace their roots back not in years or decades but in centuries. Here's a look at a few of them.

title: With Turo Withdrawal, A Slim IPO Pipeline Gets Thinner
content: Peer-to-peer car rental platform Turo became the latest venture unicorn to withdraw plans for a public offering.

title: Adapting The IPO Roadmap For Today’s Market
content: The path to IPO has become slower and more arduous for companies looking for an exit, writes Fiunder Shield's COO Carl Niedbala. In this guest commentary he lays out some effective measures to help founders be prepared when an opportunity presents itself.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: Looking Back 10 Years, Seed Investors Envisioned A Different Future Unfolding
content: Reviewing old seed funding data is a lot like going into the past to see what people thought the future would look like. Going back roughly 10 years ago, it seems OpenAI was the company every seed investor should have backed, but who knew how times would change for the intended nonprofit.

title: Global Venture Funding Slowed In April, Despite Strong AI Showing
content: Global venture funding totaled $23 billion in April 2025, flat year over year and down significantly month over month from $68 billion invested in March, Crunchbase data shows.

title: How To Leverage Your Pre-Seed Funding For Rapid And Successful Growth
content: After the pre-seed round is a time for a startup to plan for securing follow-on investments, says guest author Sergei Bogdanov, who shares early-stage funding advice to founders regarding what to do as well as what not to do.

title: Most-Active Startup Investors Spent More In Q1
content: The busiest venture backers upped their game in the recently ended first quarter. Among the 14 most-active post-seed investors, a majority backed more deals in Q1 2025 than they did a year ago.

title: Europe’s VC Funding Stayed Flat In Q1, Even As Healthcare Added A Third
content: Europe’s venture funding plateaued at $12.6 billion in Q1 2025 — flat quarter over quarter and year over year, Crunchbase data shows. Without the sort of outsized AI funding rounds seen in North America in the first quarter, the continent’s share of global funding also fell.

title: Latin America Startup Funding Fell Sequentially In Q1
content: Latin America startup investment declined sequentially in the first quarter of this year, driven by a drop in later-stage dealmaking. Even so, funding was above the depressed levels seen a year ago, and early-stage dealmaking showed signs of strength.

title: SignalFire Closes On $1B To Invest In Applied AI
content: Bay Area-based SignalFire, a data-driven venture firm, has raised $1 billion for its fifth and largest fund, which it will invest in applied AI companies.

title: North America Startup Investment Spiked In Q1 Due To OpenAI, But Seed And Early Stage Fell
content: Despite several big deals that buoyed the numbers, North America early- and seed-stage investment declined to multiquarter lows in Q1, and reported round counts fell across stages.

title: Q1 Global Startup Funding Posts Strongest Quarter Since Q2 2022 With A Third Going To Massive OpenAI Deal
content: Overall, the first quarter of 2025 marked the strongest one for venture investment since Q2 2022. Funding was up 17% quarter over quarter from the $96 billion reached in Q4 2024.

title: 7 Deadly Pitch Deck Sins, According To A VC
content: VC firms receive thousands of pitch decks a year and a typical investor will spend no more than two to three minutes assessing each one. In this guest commentary, investor Michael Tefula of Ada Ventures shares seven of the biggest mistakes that are more likely to land your pitch in the “no, thanks” rejection bin.

title: Far Fewer Seed-Stage Startups Are Graduating To Series A — Raising The Risk Of Failure
content: Companies stalled at the seed stage might be sacrificing growth to get to breakeven, which could further hinder their ability to show the traction needed to get to a Series A.
